Reviews.Title: “Don't let the neighborhood fool you!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis S
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel--definately at the upper end of Hampton properties. While it's located in a very low end neighborhood--next to 2 "all nude reviews"--you never will notice once in the hotel with it's center courtyard and pool. Balconies and decks to enjoy the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: LoriBT
Reviews.Content: My group was in San Diego for a high school baseball tournament the first week of April (our spring break). I selected this hotel from hotelplanner.com based on location, parking and price. The players and coaches were staying on the beach but the parents wanted to stay somewhere with breakfast, free parking and not too expensive. The sales manager, Kristin, and her entire staff were awesome; accommodating, friendly and attentive. They had no problem allowing a couple of us to change rooms so we could be closer the the rest of the group and allow for the kids to be more accessible to the pool and front desk area. The hotel had a nice complimentary breakfast with cereal, oatmeal, eggs (different variety each day), bread/pastries, waffles, etc. Coffee, juice and water were available throughout most of the day. They had a nice sitting area on the first floor which was perfect for parents to meet in the evenings if they didn't want to sit outside by the pool or hang out in a room. Our room was clean and comfortable, although no microwave or refrigerator. I understand you can get a fridge but would need to pay a daily fee; we had ice chests so that worked fine and each floor had an ice machine. The hotel was centrally located to the beach, Old Town, downtown, sports arena, zoo, Seaworld and freeways so we weren't far from all sorts of activities. There were also grocery stores, Target and other stores, restaurants, etc just a block or so away (also nearby is a strip club but I never felt unsafe or heard any noise). Unlike the player's hotel, Hampton Inn offered a very filling breakfast and free parking so this was a great hotel for our families and at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hampton Inn experience”
Reviews.Author: OceanBreezesSD
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was flawless. Clean, comfortable room and good breakfast. Solid wi-fi. Great location for getting to the airport. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: Johnny M
Reviews.Content: It has been such a pleasant experience staying at the Hampton Inn (Seaworld/Airport) that I am writing my first review. I have been at this hotel for about a month and I have never received such great customer service. I travel quite extensively with my job and this trip was no exception though, in hindsight, I did come quite unprepared for this trip. I have had to ask so much of the staff that I felt that they had the right to give me the cold shoulder – so to speak. However, each time I have been greeted with a smile as the consistently have gone out of their way to help me. I feel as though I have spent hours at the front desk seeking assistance! The rooms are great but that is not what seperates this hotel from the rest. It is the front desk and their great personality that has left a lasting impression on me. I would like to give special consideration to Ms. Alvarado - I can't the number of times she has gone out of her way to be of assistance. The combination of a great, comfortable room and the impeccable service has guaranteed this hotel my future business.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: davidmlowe
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were extremely helpful when we arrived. Room was basic but had all amenities required and even some more than bellagio (in room coffee machine) Beds comfy tv and channel selection good and lots of nice freebies.. Wifi in room two computers in foyer,coffee on tap all day free sofa on arrival, breakfast again free and plenty of choice inc these fabulous waffles that you make yourself with very little effort. OH and a free gym if you want to work off them waffles. Only downsides pool very small but that's ok for us we didn't come for that but I'd you hav kids it's a not great. Rooms are very poor on allowing noise to travel especially from above. I'm guessing this is down to the age and construction of the building itself, we were situated on ground floor,thought kids walking/ running around upstairs sounded like heard of elephants. We managed to leave tv on to enable us to get to sleep and it didn't spoil the stay too much. I'm sure if we had asked they would have allowed us to move rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great people! nice room and lobby, deceptive exterior.”
Reviews.Author: Rory U
Reviews.Content: Everybody I came into contact with, who worked for the hotel, were incredibly friendly and helpful, especially Amber. They greeted me warmly at the front desk, and when I had questions about the surrounding area knew all the answers. The exterior of the hotel, which is wood, could use a paint job and some TLC but don't let that throw you. The lobby is large and well done. The rooms are large, clean and well appointed. Several of them have balconies overlooking the pool. If you are looking for a fair priced, welcoming hotel that is close to many attractions and the airport, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, helpful people!”
Reviews.Author: jruggerio
Reviews.Content: I was needing a room quick and well before check-in due to a change in work. I called the hotel and asked if they had a shuttle and room ready. They said yes to both and asked if I was a HHonors member so they could book my room while I was on my way. They also allowed me to check-out late. EVERYONE I dealt with at the hotel, including the shuttle drivers, were super helpful. The room was large and clean with an awesome bed and nice TV. Breakfast wasn't all that bad either. I will use this hotel if I am in the area and need one. Great job staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Guest services Agents”
Reviews.Author: Aaron M
Reviews.Content: Justin Macias Has been nothing but a wonderful help through our stay. Going out of his way to make us feel like we are always taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - not so nice area”
Reviews.Author: jswebsterMinnesota
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice itself, however, the room could use some updating. We stayed over vacation in March and enjoyed ourselves. The staff was good. The location is a good location, however, the location is in a rough part of town. Next door are some dance places for men. Overall, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MemberfromPadova
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a relatively quiet location, near to the Old Town, SeaWorld and the airport and not that far away from the city center. My room was spacious, comfortable, spotlessly clean with free (and fast!) Wi-Fi connection. The hotel has also an outdoor swimming pool and even a small fitness center. The breakfast "on the house" is plentiful and of good quality. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. The only shortcoming is the limited parking availability. Another issue is that the hotel has no restaurant, and there are almost none in the proximities other than kentacohuts. Moreover, the immediate surroundings are rather run down. Never the less, an excellent value for the money and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: chuparosa412
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn is always a wonderful chain, and this branch exceeded our expectations as far as cleanliness, service, and amenities. The room and common areas were spotless and up-to-date, the front desk staff was helpful and friendly, and the hotel provided everything we needed and wanted (free parking, bathroom toiletries, microwave, mini-fridge, free wi-fi, free breakfast). The breakfast included apples, bananas, yogurt, fresh waffles (delicious!), bagels, toast, muffins, danishes, oatmeal, eggs, sausage, hash browns, juice, coffee, etc. The bed was so comfortable that we slept in every morning on our vacation! Our room was in the back building (#3), which was very quiet with absolutely no street noise. I only have one comment for travelers and one recommendation for the hotel: Travelers: Note that the area around the hotel is a bit "rough" with several strip clubs in the area. It's not the kind of area that I felt comfortable (or interested in) walking around. That said, the hotel itself and its grounds were secure and clean, so it was a great place to stay and take our rental car out and about in more desirable parts of San Diego. Hotel: The breakfast was delicious, but I do wish that meat was not mixed into the hot entrees (breakfast bagels with cheese, eggs, and ham; scrambled eggs with ham). Maybe you could offer ham on the side if people want to mix it into their eggs? I was also confused about the use of styrofoam plates at breakfast when there was so much emphasis on recycling at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dawn S
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn was exactly as described in other reviews. There is an adult club across the street, but frankly, I didn't see any people going in or out and they certainly did not hand out around the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located to all San Diego attractions - only a few minutes from Sea World, the Zoo and Downtown. There is a Denny's next door, and around the corner there is a shopping area with fast food and other stores and restaurants. The room was comfortable (there were 3 of us) and met our needs for our vacation. The free hot breakfast is a nice touch, although it does get quite crowded down there and one morning we had to bring the food back to our room to eat it. The staff was very nice and the lobby and room were clean. We didn't use the pool. The only issue we had was that it did get quite loud at night on the weekend from families coming back from the day, as well as people who were in town visitng military friends. The hotel is non-smoking (which is nice) but that means there are groups of young people in the parking lot smoking all night long. Overall, a very pleasant stay and I would stay there again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value and Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: mamita78
Reviews.Content: I travel 2 - 3 times a month for business and the Hampton Inn chain of hotels never seems to disappoint. We stayed here on a family vacation because of the close access to Old Town, Sea World and the Zoo. This Hampton Inn is top notch - updated lobby area and rooms, free breakfast, free parking, free wi-fi and great staff. The location is right off of a freeway exit and and I wouldn't walk anywhere from here at night (especially as a single traveler), but with car you are close to your choice of local restaurants or chain restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bob5211
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for me and my son ended up having to stay also as his flight was delayed. The staff, in particularly Hannah, was so helpful and assured me no extra charges would be paid. He had no toiletries which she made sure he had what he needed. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast inviting and the area clean. I took him to the airport and asked if I could have an extra hour to check out as I wanted to bike around the bay and then shower to head up north. No problem, Hannah said. Thanks for being flexible and making my stay less stressful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Staff and Great Quality”
Reviews.Author: papawood
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently both for business and pleasure. I am extremely impressed with the experience at this Hampton Inn from the time of check in to checking out. The front desk people are very attentive and helpful. Eddie, Caesar, Megan, Justin and the rest of the staff greet me and my wife by name when we check in. Immediately after check in the staff brings out the snack basket and ask what type of beverage we would like. The front desk crew handle any situation with professionalism and courtesy. The cleaning staff are very and efficient and are always ready to meet any request. The breakfast staff are very helpful and are constantly making sure there is plenty of food available. The General Manager, Victor is very involved in every aspect of the hotel and his attention to detail has improved the quality of the hotel and the experience of staying there. The attention to detail is appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Attentive Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel for business and pleasure constantly. The Hampton Inn Sea World in San Diego is by far the most friendly hotel we have ever had the pleasure of staying. The professionalism, yet friendliness begins with the General Manager, Victor. He takes a very proactive approach in making the hotel the friendliest and most efficiently run in the area. His knowledge and skills are very apparent. He is highly supported by the staff at the front desk. Maegen, the Front Desk Supervisor is a sweetheart and very proficient in her position. There are too many to mention, everyone at the reception desk is amazing, but Justin is definitely a favorite! The ladies in the breakfast area are always dependable and prepare food that is both healthy and appealing. The housekeeping staff is also very friendly and efficient. Overall, the Hampton Inn Sea World is a wonderful place to stay for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for your money”
Reviews.Author: Auntvalla
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the standard room and was very pleased. As an added bonus the front desk attendant, Justin was simply awesome & made our visit!

Reviews.Title: “Same great experience everytime”
Reviews.Author: ctoddg
Reviews.Content: good location, extremely clean, comfortable, and great staff. Justin does a great job of of remembering me and upgrading me when possible since i stay there 2-3 times per month. The only thing i would change is an improvement in the Wi-Fi speed. It's pretty slow.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: swartzmanh
Reviews.Content: I've had a fantastic experience at the hotel. I just returned from a stay at the Seattle Homewood Suites. I had reserved a standard king bed room because of the price, but as a Hilton honors Gold member, I was able to get a complimentary upgraded. The bed was fabulously comfortable with down pillows and soft duvet cover. I stayed there for three nights, Megan was extremely helpful she was the cherry on top of a perfect stay. She knows what she was doing and her type of service was just what i needed for a getaway. I will definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: YumaAZGirly
Reviews.Content: This Hampton in was awesome. Very spacious rooms. Clean and well cared for. Breakfast was very good. GM Victor and his staff were very welcoming and their service was top notch. Old Town San Diego is a 10 min walk. It would take longer to find a parking spot if you drive. I cant wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Successful business trip”
Reviews.Author: mgershenson
Reviews.Content: I recently booked 18 guests here for a total of 73 combined nights, and had an all day meeting at the hotel. Everyone was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel and the flexibility of the staff. I had to make pretty much constant changes to the guest list, and the sales staff was extremely helpful and accomodating. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the breakfast area was well stocked and clean. I could live without the weird omelette things, but they are pretty standard Hampton fare, so at least I wasn't surprised. The surrounding neighborhood appears, at first glance, to be a little sketchy but we had no issues. Restaurant suggestions from the front desk were right on the money. Overall, we all had a good experience here, and we will most likely come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Satisfied Guest”
Reviews.Author: ArjunSelvi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last week-end. The staff was very helpful and I would like to specially recognize Ceasar at the Front Desk who was exceptionally courteous, friendly and made us feel very welcome. He even let us have an early check-in as we had arrived quite early at the hotel due to our flight arriving early. The breakfast was exceptional. There was plently of hot food. They even change the menu every morning. There was coffee, tea and juice always available throughout the day along with fresh fruit. I would definitely stay here again and would recomend it without any reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: The service was great, especially by the front desk. The Breakfast was fabulous, and I would stay there again. Service to and from the airport was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, amazing accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Briana A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a few days and this hotel has one of the best customer services in all the hotels I have stayed in. From the moment I walked in, there was definite warmth radiating from the staff members, especially that of the staff member that checked me in, the front desk staff was very attentive! Check-in was pleasant as it was very fast and easy. The staff has excellent customer-service skills and it is apparent they are all well-trained on how they treat their customers because I felt I was receiving over-the-top services as I appreciated the littlest of things such as them greeting me when entering and leaving the premises and asking how my stay was going and whether or not I needed anything to make my stay more welcoming and accommodating. The room that I stayed in was exquisitely clean and everything was well-stocked and well-maintained. The housekeeping was great, there wasn't a single night that they missed anything in my room and they always serviced it- I was impressed my room was always taken care of upon my arrival. The staff is extremely attentive and hospitable, for example: they will call you cab if needed, however, the night I was going to use a cab the woman at the front desk was kind enough to call me back and offer their Shuttle services to save me the cab money. The complimentary breakfast was a nice option, the food was delicious, (eggs, fresh fruit, cereal, etc.,) but if I chose not to eat at the hotel, the location is perfect since there is a plethora of restaurants and eateries to chose from near the hotel and it is close to EVERYTHING in San Diego! The rooms are generously sized, very spacious, and also includes free internet. The hotel included parking which was also a great plus. Great staff, great hotel, at a great value, cannot be beat! I would not hesitate to stay here again in the future; it is definitely one of the best options in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, room and customer service!”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn2012
Reviews.Content: We booked a large bank of rooms through Desiree. She was wonderful and so helpful and took care of our last minute changes with a smile. The front desk team was so helpful and friendly. Justin and Eduardo went the extra mile to keep our group happy after long hours at an industry tradeshow. Maxine and the other morning staff, for breakfast, kept our tables clean and fresh food out for us all morning. The rooms were kept clean and neat each day by their attentive housekeeping staff. The rooms were quiet, the beds were soooo comfortable and the duvetts so lovely.... We have kept the names of our new friends so we can book again here next year.....

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rick S
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite often on business and have been treated like a king. The staff here is excellent and I want to especially mention one of your Guest Services staff, Justin Macias. He is very professional and has been extremely helpful during my many stays at the Hampton Inn San Diego Airport/SeaWorld. He has made sure that I am comfortable and well taken care of while staying here and I appreciate his attention to details. The rooms here are spacious, clean and comfortable. It is relaxing to sit by the pool with a cup of coffee and enjoy San Diego’s great weather while staying here at the Hampton Inn San Diego Airport/SeaWorld. I have recommended this hotel as the place to stay to my business associates who travel to San Diego and will continue to do so in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, courteous staff and wonderful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Bkap
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a business trip and was blown away by the customer service and attentiveness. Every member of the hotel staff was extremely helpful and made my trip a great time. The room was extremely clean and well-stocked with amenities. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. The breakfast buffet (complimentary and served each morning) was amazing! Fresh-cut fruit and oatmeal, great coffee and again, service. I actually looked forward to getting up early. My only gripe was with the location. Although it was close to the airport, it was not a particularly great part of San Diego. It was also about 15 minutes or so to downtown, which made getting into the city and enjoying myself a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: katkataar
Reviews.Content: My flight was delayed so by the time I got there the shuttle service was no longer running. I had been told the day before to just call and the shuttle would pick me up, by the time I called the driver had left for the day Amber was very apologetic and called me several times on my phone to help me find a cab and get to the hotel. When I got there she was all smiles and cheered me up considerably, people don't understand how far just a smile will take you. During my check Amber was very polite and was genuinely sorry that I had to take a taxi to the hotel after I was told that the shuttle would pick me up. For my inconvenience she upgraded me to a room with a balcony. Mehgan and Eddie who checked me out the next morning were also very helpful in getting me directions to where I wanted to go. Your staff is superb. I work in retail and more often than not we get bad reviews and not enough good ones. So great job to you all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: K_MckUtah
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. It was clean and staff were friendly and helped in any way they could. The breakfast was top notch and included a great variety including cut-up fresh fruit! We were upgraded without asking to a room located by the gazebo. We loved it. It was quiet, clean, and smelled nice. We loved the comfortable bed and felt safe and warm while we were here. Even though the area around wasn't the best location, we never felt like we were not safe due to the security measures the hotel and staff took to help keep the hotel safe and secure. We also loved the hot tub and the pool. It was a wonderful stay and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay - Superior Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: momofnatalie
Reviews.Content: After a long day at Sea World, we found our way to the Hampton Inn. Just a warning, your GPS will give you strange directions and you really need to keep your eyes out for the hotel. I knew from reading the reviews that the area was in question, but when we arrived, the parking lot was well lit and there were no strange people lurking around. I went and checked in and was greeted by the friendly staff. I was given an upgrade to a room with a fridge and microwave which was greatly appreciated since we had our 2 year old daughter with us. I asked about restaurant recommendations and was given a helpful list in which the front desk person, put stars on the places that were close by and had great food. She offered me a refreshment and asked how many I needed. I was pleasantly surprised on their hospitality and left their desk with a smile on my face. When we entered the room, it was at the back of the property and it was very well decorated. There was a strange scent when I walked in, and wasn't sure what it was. I sprayed the room with my orange air freshener and it smelled a lot better. The room was large and had a small sink adjacent to the microwave and fridge. I noticed there was some white residue caked on that faucet and it looked like it might need some cleaning. I decided to just use the bathroom sink to wash my daughter's cup. Besides that the room was clean and I appreciated that they use a duvet and have a sign that they use fresh linens for every patron. The breakfast was awesome, there was fresh fruit, hot oatmeal, waffles, potatoes, turkey sausage, eggs with ham and cheese, breads and pastries. The staff was so friendly and there was a member of the management office who came by to say hello and she even cleared people's plates. She talked to a lady at the next table who needed directions and she printed them out for her and gave her the no freeway route as requested. I truly have to say that the customer service was fantastic and for that reason alone, I would be happy to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay at The Hampton Inn San Diego Sea World when in town!!! Best Hotel in San Diego hands down!”
Reviews.Author: Hampton100
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn San Diego Sea World has the best staff. Freindly, effiecient and courteous. Very helpful in finding me great places to eat in the area. The rooms were clean. beds comfortable and very spacious. Lobby is beautiful and the breakfast was great. So many choices of breakfast items. Breakfast Hostess was very pleasant and freindly as well. Victor (the General Manager) of the hotel has a great staff and he himself is very inter active with the guests. Great staff comes from a great leader. So props to thi San Diego Hampton. I will for sure stay no where else when I am in town. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty!!!”
Reviews.Author: iluvny_10
Reviews.Content: I met a group of my friends in San Diego for my birthday and we wanted to stay near Old Town. When I made the reservation they asked me what was the purpose of my visit and I told them that it was for my birthday. Well they must have made note of it, because when I arrived at the hotel everyone of the staff wished me a Happ Birthday! They gave me a complimentary upgrade to an awesome suite with a balcony and left a gift basket full of goodies and a birthday card that all of the staff had personally signed. I mean WOW! This "special" treatment continued throughout my entire stay. I can't tell you how perfect this hotel made my birthday. I will be returning to this hotel again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Big Bang for Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: KalihiKid65
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great. They all seemed to be happy doing their jobs and we benefitted from it. The front-desk personnel were so helpful. When it was raining, we had to nix our trip to Sea World; but the guy at the front desk gave us the suggestion of going to Balboa Park instead. We spent the whole day at Balboa Park and still didn't see everything. It was a great day. The room was good and clean. I think for the money we paid, we had a big bang for our buck. The staff made it so much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Martinak and Ferrig Trip”
Reviews.Author: judith_martinak
Reviews.Content: Your staff is incredibly well trained and professional, of course. The room was immaculate and we felt any request we had would be granted. We used the front desk for everything and took their recommendation for restaurant and driving (those small hand out cards are a great help with directions).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: HikingGirl_8
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the staff. Everyone from the front desk staff to the breakfast area staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. It made our stay very pleasant! This hotel is located close to everything that we wanted to visit, including the zoo, Sea World, the Cabrillo National Monument, and has easy freeway access nearby. The bed in our room was adequate - not the most comfortable that I've had at a Hampton Inn, but we were still able to sleep. There was a little bit of road noise in the room, but again, it didn't prevent us from sleeping. The pool was nice and warm and the hot tub was quite hot, so we enjoyed using them at night - very relaxing! - even though there was a definite chill in the air on the January evenings. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying here and if we return to San Diego, we will be visiting this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Always A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: karen k
Reviews.Content: When ever traveling out of town we always try to stay at a Hampton Inn. The rooms are always clean and comfortable infact the matresses are so comfortable that we ordered one for our own home a couple of years ago! This Hampton Inn is in a great location with all major sights within a few miles. There are lots of stores and restaurants close by and just minutes from Old Town where we took a narrated day trolley that took us all over San Diego. All of the attractions are close by with great freeway access.The hotel staff were as wonderful and helpful as they always are and the expanded complimentary hot breakfast is always an added plus with lots of choices to choose from. And the heated pool and spa at this location was certainly a treat after a long day of sightseeing! As far as the neighborhood goes, yes it is an older neighborhood but we were much too busy seeing the sights or relaxing in the hotel for that to be a bother to us in the least!

Reviews.Title: “The front desk staff is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Marylee D
Reviews.Content: I live in Mexico so when I travel I often stay at this hotel. My experiences on my 2 stays in December (the evening before I left San Diego and the evening on my return) were enhanced this time by the friendliness of the staff at the front desk. Maegen Ibanez was especially helpful and friendly on check in and check out my first stay and the 2 men on duty on the 18th likewise. It was a pleasure to be treated so nicely. I would also like to mention that the shuttle service there is also superb. Breakfast and cookies were great. The neighborhood may be run down as someone mentioned, but the staff makes you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired and worn”
Reviews.Author: DogMomTravel
Reviews.Content: Not one of the better Hampton Inns . . .property is a bit tired/worn. Neighborhood seemed a bit run down and property was not easy to get in/out of despite its proximity to freeway given there is no traffic signal where you turn in. Staff is incredibly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: paul i
Reviews.Content: This Seaworld Hampton Inn is perfectly located to all the attractions in San Diego. I like this place especially because there are tons of restaurant options within a 1/2 mile of the place. Especially great is the wonderful customer service given by the front counter staff. I always feel welcome after a hard day's work when I am in San Diego conducting business. Supervisor Maegan sets an excellent example for the front counter team with her great smile and positive attitude.The rooms are always perfect and looking fresh. I would highly suggest this hotel for anyone who works in Downtown San Diego area but doesn't want to hassle with the hustle and bustle of the downtown area and wants to relax after business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Miu2000
Reviews.Content: Good location. (I saw the review before I come here regarding the nude club outside, I can tell you they are just there but no need to worry about it at all. It is safe) Have nice breakfast. The staffs ars super helpful and friendly. They gave us a brunch suggestion for the restaurant and supermarket close by. So feel free to ask them anything there. The room is clean tho u see it is bit old hotel but I would definitely recommend it!! One downside is the Internet was so slow that u can nearly check the web page but nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Marines Graduation”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Our family and a few friends were in San Diego for our sons graduation from the Marines basic training. The acommedations were wonderful, the rooms were always clean for us and extra linens were never a problem. The breakfast each morning was really nice, each day had a different menu and the area for the buffet was kept very clean and organized. The staff did a great job of helping us back and forth from the Marine Corp Recruit Depot, and providing suggestions and directions to resturants and attraction thru-out the city. They made our stay in San Diego much easier and very enjoyable. Our thanks and gratitude for helping us have a stress free trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis W
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous comments about the location of this Hampton Inn, I was a little concerned. It is true that the surrounding area is a little tired looking, but the hotel was very attractive, spotlessly clean, and very conveniently located. The lobby and outdoor courtyard are especially attractive, the beds were very comfortable, and hot breakfast bar was outstanding. The young man who was working the front desk during the day when we were there on Nov. 24, 25, and 26, 2011 was super helpful and very pleasant. The people who are managing, operating, and maintaining this Hampton Inn are doing a fantastic job!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carmen A
Reviews.Content: They say don't judge a book by its cover. This is one of those incidents. When I first arrived at the hotel my first thought was what have i gotten myself into but what a surprise. The service here was outstanding. The rooms were clean, the breakfast was wonderful, and the staff was absolutely amazing. Eddie and Justin went above and beyond our expectations by greetings us at check in and offering us water after a long day of traveling. I felt treated more then just a guest. Great stay and great job I would definitely return to this hotel the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “#1 choice to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: pbwizard
Reviews.Content: Spent 12 nights here during visit to see our new granddaughter. The rooms were clean, large and comfortable. The front staff was top notch and responded right away to any concerns or questions. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job in upkeeping our room on a daily basis. Loved the daily change of menu in the well maintained breakfast area. We plan to return again and again to this hotel during our trips to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Rick T
Reviews.Content: The location is close to Sea World and just off the freeway to get to major attractions. The surrounding area is a bit questionable (a few adult attractions close by), but, the location was safe and comfortable overall. Staff was helpful to change our original room due to severe noise from the A/C fan right outside the window (I would recommend staying towards the back of the property...much quieter). The property is well maintained with nicely landscaped grounds. I would definitely stay here again for the money with the advance purchase option.

Reviews.Title: “Just before we went home..... bye bye USA”
Reviews.Author: Hans G
Reviews.Content: During our holiday we've stayed most of the time in Hampton Inn's - and all are perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here the night before or after your stay at Rancho La Puerta”
Reviews.Author: Carol B
Reviews.Content: Every year I go to Rancho La Puerta on vacation and every year I stay at this Hampton Inn the night before. Since I travel from New York it pays to leave one day earlier and spend the night at Hampton so I can arrive bright and early at Rancho La Puerta for the day's activities. I've recently included reserving a room after my stay. Instead of rushing to the airport the day my Ranch week ends, I stay at the Hampton Inn and relax, browse the local shopping and choose one of the many restaurants for dinner within walking distance of the hotel. It's the perfect way to end my vacation. The staff is warm, friendly, and extremely helpful. Victor, the Manager, is a real professional -- he gets the job done and always has time to say hello. The rooms are tastefully decorated and kept immaculate...and the bed and bedding are luxurious. If you call from the airport, a van will pick you up and return you when your stay is done, all complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “My go-to place when visiting Sea World”
Reviews.Author: deebeear
Reviews.Content: This place is super close to Sea World and after a day at the park, there's nothing better than driving just three miles to the hotel. Check in is always a breeze and while there might be a little bit of a walk to the room, the rooms are always clean and comfortable enough, especially given the price. Pool stays open 'til 10, and a soak in the hot tub is a great way to unwind after a day of chasing the munchkins all around Shamuland. Breakfast, included, is usually a bit of a madhouse, but the food, while institutional, is good enough to get a good start on the day. Nice selection of juices, fruit, coffee, and two waffle makers, eggs, sausage of some sort and assorted pastries. It's not the Ritz, but if you're looking for a place to crash between amusement parks, this hotel will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Service at your fingertips”
Reviews.Author: bobdanabrittany
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. We have stayed here twice once for enjoyment and another time for a wedding. My husband is handicapped and they made sure i have everything i needed and also if i was satisfied after they got what ever I needed. They may not have everything perfect, but if pointed out to them, they resolved the situation immediately and then it was perfect. Great little work out room, pool very clean, great meals, was here for a week and a different selection each morning.- I like a little change. Again the staff even called me by name at the front desk - very well trained!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Ponceno1969
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. The staff is really friendly and knowledgeable about the area. It seems to be an older property that was remodeled, but they did a fantastic job.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn - Seaworld/Airport is so convenient to virtually every thing you might want to see or do in San Diego. As one of their front desk staff jokingly told me...."We're 10 minutes from everything." The fact is that they actually are. The hotel is very clean, the staff is super friendly and eager to answer any "tourist type" question you may have. They offered up one of the best breakfasts we've ever had in a Hampton property. The offered up maps of the city and showed us how to find great restaurants, the zoo, airport, etc. We could only stay two nights but we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: heumanntouch
Reviews.Content: This location is nice and the service is fantastic, but getting in and out of this location is rather difficult. It is less than 1 mile from Old Town so if you are planning on visiting this area, this location is for you. The hotel is rather oddly laid out but is quite, and has a older kept up decor. The room was very large and included a refrigerator and microwave. The parking was fine, and the workout room is VERY small (one treadmill) I was here on business and would return to this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: brazil44
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was better than any Hampton Inn I have ever stayed at. We checked in an hour early and was greated with a cookie and a smile. It was nice to be asked what floor we prefer and if we wanted a courtyard view or pool view. Rooms are very clean and updated. The hotel is a short 10-15 minute walk to Old Town. There are also several restaurants (Denny's, Olive Garden, Chili's) very close by. They provide a full breakfast including make-your-own belgian waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal, fruits and yogurt. Breakfast is available from 6am, which is good if you have an early flight. We took the shuttle to the airport at 6:30am. It runs on the half hour...and right on time. I would stay at this hotel again next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Luvdaoutdoors
Reviews.Content: The staff was fantastic and clean..front desk was accomodating, friendly and definitely helpful. Breakfast was good and filling. The room was clean and any staff you passed by were nice and accomodating. We had better service here than the hotel we stayed at the night before and was double the price. The only downside is where the hotel was located. Strips clubs nearby but didn't witness anything fishy around.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, well maintained property”
Reviews.Author: yinhh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little bit expensive than hotels of the same level but it's worth it. The staff, especially the gentleman at front desk was very friendly and helpful. The free airport shuttle service was fast and convenient. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and I got to make my own waffle =D The only complain I have is that the room was far from soundproof, probably because the rather large gap between the door and the carpet, but that's expected. Still, I woke up around 2am in the morning hearing someone moving stuff through the emergency exit. Oh, yes there are 2 strip clubs near the hotel. But I didn't sense any bad elements around the area. I felt much safer walking around this area alone at late night (around 11:30pm) than in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: chinasonvacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night before going to our condo in Laguna Beach for the week. Check in went smooth and were offered chocolate chip cookies before going up to our room. The room was spacious with a small fridge, microwave, king bed, and patio. The bathroom was a good size and very clean. The bed was very comfy. Wake up call was received when promised and the free breakfast was nice. They had the usual Hampton Inn goodies, make it yourself waffles, sausage, scrambled eggs, baked goods, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, juices, etc. Check out was a breeze and we were off to Sea World. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other looking to stay in this area. It was very easy to find and a very short drive to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff - Typical Hampton property”
Reviews.Author: albelora
Reviews.Content: Very nice room and breakfast. Everything I needed was here. Shuttle from the airport was a bit slow to pick me up, but it got there. Shuttle back was fantastic. I believe the general manager was the driver, and she was full of information about where to go in San Diego. Thanks! Neighorhood looked a bit rough, but I walked across the street to a Mexican restaurant and had a pretty decent meal. No issues noted.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Gerard D
Reviews.Content: When I pulled in to the Hampton Inn, I expected the standard experience. Good, but predictable. I was extremely positively surprised to find spacious rooms, modern decor, outstanding fitness room and my room had a balcony overlooking the pool. The staff was outstanding and they were proactive and thoughtful concerning every detail. I would definitely rate them an A+

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PakdeGaBi
Reviews.Content: Stayed only for one night after driving from Los Angeles, to continue flying to San Francisco the next day. Hampton Inn was a real deal! After arriving from Los Angeles and spending the whole afternoon at the Sea World, we (myself, my wife and 14YO son) would be looking forward for a fast, efficient check in and refreshing shower. And Hampton Inn San Diego Sea World provided those. The room (double queen bed) is very spacious, complete with many cable-TV channels to select. All the beds were very comfortable with thick soft pillow. The room itself is clean with simple modern atmosphere and the (thick) door also felt very secure with cardkey entry. The thick carpet also looked and felt very clean. The bathroom is also clean, not a huge one but with adequate space for you not to feel cramped. Good showers with warm water and sufficient water pressure. Towels are provided generously and smells nice too. Wifi is available in the room, free, but somehow it felt a bit slower. I don't know why, maybe because we requested for a room far away at the back of the hotel, hoping for a calm and quiet environment. We didn't bother for this since we stayed only for one night. As we have the room which is quiet as expected, I also realise that most of the area of this hotel are also quiet. So I guess (almost) all the windows and exit doors are doing their job fine in blocking the noise from outside. Parking is also non problem. At a quick glance, you may notice that it seems all the parking spaces have been occupied, but then look carefully and closely, there are always about 3 to 4 spaces available. I noticed this, because eventhough we stayed only for one night, we did go out and returned to the hotel twice. Breakfast is a real plus. Nice large breakfast room with lots of choices of breads, waffles, pancakes, muffins and cereals with fruit juices, milk, chocolates, coffee and tea. They have eggs and even my son enjoyed very much when he made his own waffles. The surroundings. A couple reviews I read before selecting this hotel, have mentioned about the nude bar located next to the hotel. My opinion, I didn't feel the uncomfortable feeling as mentioned on those review. First, the bar does not located directly next to the hotel, and somehow it does not placed itself entirely provocating. I felt that because later in the evening, we took a walk and went to Dennys for dinner (FYI, there are many choices if ones decided to go dining outside, within walking distance). There is also a pool but we didn't have the opportunity to use it, although it looks fairly inviting. So conclusion is: (+): Check-in/out staffs, clean spacious bed room, great breakfast, quiet, comforting beds. (-) : A bit slow internet, AC a bit noisy (in my room). I would be staying here again definitely and recommend this hotel for you all.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Wadi S
Reviews.Content: This excellent Hampton Inn is away from the sky-high Downtown prices and those pricier hotels closer to the Airport. I have stayed here on three different trips and each stay has been great. It has easy access to several highways and to the beaches. (A note: Watch for the one-way street in front of hotel.) Some have complained that this Hampton is not near anything but fast-food restaurants. Not true! I found several excellent small places with good food and reasonable prices, all within walking distance. Ask for suggestions at the front desk. I like this hotel. The staff is friendly; the breakfast bar is refilled quickly. Guests range from tourists (Sea World is very close) to military families attending welcome home ceremonies and graduations to business people from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL Stay !”
Reviews.Author: kmshoo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here during our first few days in San Diego after moving from Massachusetts. The staff was amazingly friendly and accommodating in every way possible! Never have we experienced such wonderful customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley C
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really nice, clean, and spacious. They have a great breakfast in the morning, a pool, and hot tub. The people at the front desk are very accommodating! They are so friendly and will work with you. They booked our date wrong over the phone and gave us a free night at the hotel. I highly recommend you stay here. It is a nice location and there is shuttle to and from the airport. This has been my best hotel experience yet.

Reviews.Title: “We love Hampton Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Linny_1975
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn hasn't disappointed us so far! This hotel in San Diego was also very good and the breakfast was even better, we were very pleased! Close to Sea World. Room was really spacious & very clean, also the breakfast area was large enough (larger then we've seen on this holiday with 10 different hotels). Also very friendly staff. Next year we'll search for a Hampton Inn hotel again, that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Power Outage Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gilbert0
Reviews.Content: We were staying in the Hampton Inn Seaworld/Airport starting the day of the great power outage. Luckily, we were able to check in earlier in the day (somewhere around noon, instead of the normal three o clock check in), The staff was very accomodating checking us in early and there was no problems. Our room was on the first floor (one without a deck or balcony). After check in, we headed over to Cabrillo NM and Mission Beach. Both are highly recommended and very close to the hotel. Cabrillo is beautiful and Mission Beach was fun. Except this is where we experienced the power outage while shopping in one of the beach front stores. So since the stores closed, we just walked around on the beach picking up shells and getting some sun. After an hour of noticing the power hadn't come back on we decided to head back to the hotel. Traffic was a nightmare and it took forever. Every business had closed, and everyone was in their car trying to get home. We finally made it to the hotel with some light left in the day. The staff remained very calm and had flashlights that they were using to guide guests to their rooms since no lights were on. There was still hot coffee in the lobby and they were handing out bottled water. Information they had was passed along, including info on a local restaurant that was still open and serving food. They handled a terrible situation the best anyone could have and they need to be commended for it. Hopefully another power outage of this scale will ever happen again in San Diego, but if it does I can promise that this Hampton is well prepared to endure it. The power went out about 330 in the afternoon and came on around 330 the next morning. The rest of the trip and stay was very plesant as well. The breakfast here is one of the best I've had compared to other Hilton's and Hampton's. The staff worked very hard to keep everything stocked. The waffles are great, and the hot dishes like scrambled eggs, omlets, potatoes, meats were varied each day so that nothing became boring. Fresh fruit, juice, cearal, yogurt, bagels, etc are also provided. Lots of papers floating around and two tvs on CNN for morning news. Never did visit the pool, but it looked very nice. Very close to SeaWorld and pretty close and easy to access the zoo. Highly recommended! Make sure to hit up Sportsman Seafood near Mission Beach/Sea World for some awesome seafood!

Reviews.Title: “Black Out 2011”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton in early September and were immediately impressed by the beautiful lobby and breakfast area. We arrived a bit before check in time, but the friendly staff allowed us to check in and gave us an amazing room that overlooked the pool. Unfortunately for San Diego county, the great blackout of 2011 hit that afternoon- the 8th of Sept. We were so impressed with how the staff handled the situation. They quickly began preparations for what was going to be a long dark night. We were approached by Hotel staff regularly to make sure we had water, food, etc. As night fell and it became evident that the power was not coming back on anytime soon, the staff began handing out flashlights as well as putting out snacks, drinks, fruit, yogurt, and other food to help all of us get through a tough night. Fortunately, the power came back on early the next morning. We stayed that night and one more and had an amazing day at Sea World. Desiree Weyls and the rest of the staff should be commended for performing at such a high level during a taxing situation. We are already planning another trip to San Diego and will undoubtedly stay at the Hampton Inn San Diego Airport/ Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “5 minute drive from Sea World, friendly staff, best value”
Reviews.Author: fortmac_eric
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because of its proximity to Sea World plus we always stay at the Hampton Inn in West Edmonton. This was no disappointment. The front desk was friendly, they gladly granted my request to be in a room on a high floor away form the elevator. The rooms were clean and properly maintained, and the complimentary hot breakfast was great. It’s also just half an hour away from Legoland, Carlsbad where we went the next morning before going back to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice updated property, sketchy area”
Reviews.Author: Pagz
Reviews.Content: The lobby area is all new and the breakfast was one of the best I've seen at Hamptons and I travel weekly. The rooms are large but you can tell this was an older hotel that is being refurbished. Some of the tiles are replaced, but the wallpaper is still old as are some of the fixtures in the guest bathrooms. This location is very close to the airport, Old Town, and the highway, but the neighborhood is still a bit sketchy with a strip club about a block away. No surveillance system yet outside, which worries me a bit. Good prices for the location just keep your kids close.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here everytime when in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: DaChanClan
Reviews.Content: Pros: Affordable (only $100/night for the weekend), central location (very close to concert venue & sea world), extremely friendly & helpful staff, hooked us up with an upgraded room because we requested a crib/rollaway bed, spotless everywhere, big rooms, comfy king bed, FREE decent breakfast, FREE wi-fi, FREE hot tea/coffee 24/7, decent pool, jacuzzi & gym...best $100/day i've spent for a family mini-vacation. Cons: if you make a wrong turn, you're sort of screwed. It's located directly off the offramp of two highways and some one-way streets. Do yourself a favor and map out your route beforehand. Also, neighborhood is straight ghetto with two nudie bars within a block, as well as transients hanging outside of the rear parking lot either in RVs, on their bikes, or in the dumpsters. Don't leave anything valuable in your car and you should probably bring a buddy if you need to get to your car at night. Although the parking lot is gated with spiked fences, there were no visible security cameras in the rear parking lot (Door 3). I suggest having a visible staff or security guard routinely visible there.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - even without power”
Reviews.Author: Emily P
Reviews.Content: The staff and service have been great during normal trips but they went above a beyond when all of San Deigo lost power. Staff brought out food and drinks for guests since local restaurants were closed, kept guests informed of the news and did it all with smiles. With power out for 12 hours, the staff still came in the following morning to prepare breakfast and help guests.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: iammadeline
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of visiting San Diego many times, and I rarely stay at another hotel. I like the Hampton Inn chain in general, and this is one of my favorites. The central location with easy access to freeways and the Pacific Coast Highway is especially convenient, the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, the free WiFi works great (and there are wired computers available in the lobby as well), parking is easy, and the staff is outstanding. Also, happily, I have always found it quiet. And only once have I ever encountered a problem (insufficient hot water in the shower)--which was fixed immediately, and they reduced my bill to compensate for the inconvenience. As with other Hampton Inns, the buffet breakfast is fairly standard fare, but there is lots of variety, including hot dishes, and they are very attentive with keeping everything stocked. If I were to make any suggestion, it would be to include some slightly more healthful (organic) breads, cereals, and juices, for which I would be willing to pay a little extra. But this is minor. Overall, a great place to stay in San Diego. That's why I keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic as always”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay Great staff and clean facility.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice!”
Reviews.Author: Luvlyeyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best we have stayed in. Great service every time we stay, the price is fair, and Great location! Plus it's close to our favorite sushi restaurant: Tsuruya Sushi. Well defenatly continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied all around”
Reviews.Author: Findley123104
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after a day at Sea World. It was about a ten minute drive from Sea World. The gentleman at the desk was very informative. Without us asking, they had upgraded our room. He also recommended some good places to eat in the area. Parking was a little tight but the hotel was very busy for Labor Day weekend. It is also in a bit of a weird location as it is surrounded on all but the main street side by industrial buildings. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms looked newly renovated with flatscreen TV's etc. Overall a nice place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Lonie52
Reviews.Content: Came in for a one night business trip and my room wasn't ready, but they happily took and stored my luggage so I could tour the area. They were very helpful in pointing me in the right direction to all the "touristy" spots that I was eager to see. A trolley station is located behind the hotel, and Little Italy is two block one way, and the harbor area two blocks the other way. Great location! The room was really nice and clean as well. Great job to the staff! One more thing; if you can't tolerate train noise, ask for the front of the hotel. It doesn't bother me, and didn't occur often, but you might want to bring earplugs if you are sensitive to it.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hampton well run”
Reviews.Author: Ann1609
Reviews.Content: This is a really large Hampton -- some rooms have patios or balconies. Rooms are large. Breakfast buffet can get really crowded -- lots of families staying here. Guest computer/printer in the lobby and nice staff. They found an i-phone charger I could use overnight. It's a bit difficult to get to the hotel from a few directions, but aside from that, we like this one a lot!

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK.”
Reviews.Author: mndawn63
Reviews.Content: Would I stay here again? I guess I could go either way. The rooms were not the cleanest but they were OK. There were this little skinny, shiny long bugs in the bathroom every single morning when you turned the light on they came out. Don't know what they were but YUK! The pool outside looked OK but we didn't use it--too much other stuff to do in San Diego. The beds were comfortable enough. Walls seemed a little thin but with the air on and earplugs I didn't hear much. Great location if you want to be close to Sea World and not to far from the San Diego Zoo. Convenient to lots of things. Breakfast was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy bathroom, but decent rate for a room with two beds and a sleeper sofa.”
Reviews.Author: commercialloanbroker
Reviews.Content: We had to wait for our room, so they knocked $50 off the room, which was nice. Hotel may be only a few miles from everything you want to do in San Diego, but it's not in the best area. There's a strip club a block or two down the street, but the hotel parking lot didn't feel that unsafe. There is a dive hotel next door. The AC doesn't run unless there's someone in the room, which is annoying because it was always too warm and stuffy when we returned. But the most annoying thing was the poor lighting in the bathroom. A single 65w light covers the whole room, including the shower. There's an old fashioned heat lamp too, but it heats up the little bathroom so fast that if you have more than one person showering, the room gets unbearably hot. So, if you can find something nicer for the price in the area, go for it. But this hotel is an OK value if you can't.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: tallcodude
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because the price was good and the location was good. It was very close to downtown, Mission Bay, Old Town, and Point Loma. No complaints there. My only complaint would be I stayed on the back side of the hotel and the industrial business next store was loud early in the morning. This neigbhorhood is one that is transitioning from old industrial to new commercial, It is not dangerous at all. The strip club next store is a non-starter. You wont even think about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near everything”
Reviews.Author: Rich733
Reviews.Content: While this is near some adult entertainment places it is really not an issue, especially if you have a car. The facility is very well maintained and very clean, the complimentary Breakfast is excellant with a wide variety of food and drink offerings available. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable and helpful. We have stayed there many times and have always enjoyed it as a reasonable and quality place. Good pool also! We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not your standard Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: 007DAWG
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid the bad outweighs the good here, but it is a mixed bag. The good: Friendly helpful front desk staff. Very nice well maintained outdoor pool area. The bad: Paper thin walls, very expensive for a hampton Inn, unfriendly breakfast staff (asked for a tray and was very grufly told "you have one in your room"), rough neighborhood. Shortened my visit from 2 to 1 night, would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Christypix
Reviews.Content: My family and I took a last minute trip to San Diego for fourth of July. I have stayed at numerous hotels(Omni, Hilton, Westin,Hyatt) in san diego. Over the years i have found myself to be very particular where i stay at. But since this was a last minute trip my choices was limited. I have never stayed at an "Hampton Inn" but was pleasantly surprised. I was kindly greated upon check in and was given a room right away. The room was large with a king bed and a single pull out couch. Nice Plasma LG tv, refigerator and microwave. Everything was clean,and fairly new furniture. The price was great especially for a last minute thing ($113) which included parking, internet, and a hot breakfast. This is a perfect place for a family trip to San Diego, it is in close proximity to everything and right of the five freeway. Now the only reason why i would stay at the gaslamp area is if I am going there to have cocktails and dont want to drive. The gaslamp has tons of hotels but most charge ridiculous fees to park($20-$30), resort fees, and lots of times the rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie07
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel close to Sea World and just a short drive to downtown San Diego. The room was spacious, clean and updated. Very quiet - we were on the first floor. Pool area looked nice though we did not use it. Staff very nice and helpful. The lobby area and breakfast area was very nice and the breakfast was very good. Nice to have a filling breakfast before a long day at Sea World. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive! Bad parking! Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: jimmiekain
Reviews.Content: The good: its close to Seaworld, clean, the employees are kind, close to restaurants and that's about it. **** The bad: the parking is terrible, its too expensive, they have old style box tv's, they gave us a room next to the parking lot and it was very loud, the refrigerator in my room did not get cold, the shower was either too hot or too cold, the heater stinks... The list goes on and on. We will not be back. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Go somewhere with enough parking spaces that costs less and at least has flat screen tv's. (again the people who work the front desk are very nice and professional)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely staff but noise disrupted sleep”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugged
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night, May 21-22 2011, on a weekend break. Plusses: The location is excellent for San Diego's old town - just the other side of the freeway, less than a mile away. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. We were offered a complimentary upgrade. The room was great, very comfortable, and everything worked. The buffet breakfast was also great. There was a large, widescreen TV in our room. Minuses: The rooms are all wrapped around a central atrium and the partition walls between the rooms are somewhat thin, thus creating a major noise problem. I was woken up several times during the night by activity in the room next to ours, and then at around 5am by people heading off to early morning flights. If you are a light sleeper this is possibly not the best hotel for you. There is also no bar or restaurant as part of the hotel. There are several options within a mile or so, but you're either looking at a drive (which rules out a drink with dinner) or a 10-20 minute walk (possibly not a good idea after dark).

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as described”
Reviews.Author: Chemicalx81
Reviews.Content: I tried to book a hotel close to the Airport to catch an early morning flight. Hotel itself was ok and you've been recognized as a HHonors Status Customer. The room was ok, but nothing special. The Balcony was kinda in the corner so if youlook outside, you'll see the wall of the other Building. Bath was ok, nothing special. If it is for one night, then ok. If you do vacation, you might choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Hampton Inn, average at best”
Reviews.Author: ynp-CV
Reviews.Content: First, the problems others mention--the "nudie bars" are NOT right across the street, they are a good block away with other establishments/businesses in between and I was never influenced by that area or the people who went in/out of those establishments. They didn't even really seem busy and I was there on a weekend. Don't let this scare you away from staying here. The parking was adequate and I never had a problem. The people who can't find this hotel must be travel-challenged. It is right off the I-5/I-8 interchange ramp. There are 2 major streets (Rosecrans & Camino del Rey) paralelling this property, from either one--just take Hancock (one way) into the property and Kurtz (one way out) away from the property, no problems at all. Just pay attention to where you are going, it isn't hard. Also be aware that this isn't your typical clean bright shiny Hampton Inn. It appears to be an older hotel that was taken over by Hampton Inns. Rooms, especially the carpets and furnishings are a bit dated and worn and the interior hallways are very dimly lit in some areas. The first night I was given a terrible room location-wise. Do NOT take a room near the front or front corners of this property, the street noise is terrible all night long. Plus I was awakened by a loud train whistle many times until 2:30 AM, but the front desk claims there isn't a train nearby????? Duh, I didn't make up the train waking me up 6 times from 11 PM to 2:30 AM????? Luckily it quit after 2:30 AM. For the second night I asked to be changed and the manager was very cordial and very accommodatingly upgraded my room to one with a balcony, fridge, and microwave. This room, near the back of the property was a little better furnishings-wise than the first room, but still needed a modern makeover. The room was very large, the bed was very comfy and the TV had about 40 channels, including HBO. But this room had its problems also. Like many hotel rooms everywhere, the sink drained very slowly. The wall thermostat controlled the heating unit, but no matter how high you put the thermostat the unit blew very little heat at all and the fan at times got VERY VERY noisy. I didn't bother asking for another room, I just figured most rooms would have their problems considering the worn condition of the furnishings in the 2 rooms I had. The day I checked out I called the front desk to complain about my neighbors smoking on their balcony and how they had done that all day yesterday also. It virtually made the balcony unusable having to smell their drifting smoke smell. How can people smoke on a private attached-to-their-room balcony in a non-smoking hotel? The front desk lady said "we can't police that, but if we smell smoke, we charge them $200 to change the drapes, etc." How about stopping them from smoking in a non-smoking hotel period--those are YOUR rules? The breakfast WAS typical Hampton Inn. Many choices, plus daily changes of the hot entrees. The breakfast area was large and well-stocked. The hotel seemed very busy when I was there and the area was full most times, but the overflow area always had an extra table or two. That portion of this hotel was very good. The lobby was nice and spacious, but the lobby computers were VERY slow, probably the slowest I've ever encountered in any hotel ever. Must be a very slow dial-up. Didn't use the room wifi so don't know about that speed, but the lobby computers were terribly slow. As long as you understand that this is not a typical bright shiny Hampton Inn, then you'll most likely be pleased with most things. Location and price almost balance out the property's shortcomings. But I just can't honestly rate this dated property anything better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased”
Reviews.Author: WaterEnthusiasts
Reviews.Content: I knew when I booked a room at this Hampton Inn that, well, it is what it is. The hotel is, as advertised by other Tripadvisor members, directly across the street from two "nude review" bars. In that respect, this hotel will never be particularly appealing. The area is industrial/commercial in nature, and no one is going to much like that, either. I stayed at this hotel because it had a courtesy hotel shuttle bus. The problem is, there is only one bus and, after waiting over thirty minutes for the shuttle, I booked a cab to the airport at a cost of $20. In the morning, the shuttle service was overbooked and I had to book another cab, and spend another $20. As I waited at the airport, I saw the Sheraton and a Holiday Inn's shuttle buses come and go three times. The Hampton's shuttle never arrived. I called three times to ask where it was. Each time I was told to wait another 5 to 10 minutes. I waited, and nothing arrived. Next time, I will stay at a higher end hotel rather than try to save a buck at this hotel. As for the rooms and facility, they are adequate but dated and uninspired. I will not stay at this hotel again, and will not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: CoasterWarrior
Reviews.Content: My business was with Seaworld, so this hotel is very well located. I have stayed here several times before and always left with the sense that this is a very nice property...especially for the price. My only issue was that when my neighbors ran their showers it transferred to my room very loudly. Fortrunately, this was early in the evening and did not prevent me from getting a good night's rest. There is reasonale shopping and food close, and the hotel is just off the intersection of the 5 and 8 freeways making it convenient to most of the San Diego area

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: treinke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights right before Christmas right after the huge rains in southern California. We didn't notice any problems that they might have had from flooding. We had an awesome deal by prepaying for the room ($67/night). The breakfast area was quite large and they have two elevators. One broke down while we were there but it was fine. The lobby area is huge.

Reviews.Title: “Strip Club Across the Way Is a Feature; Not a Problem”
Reviews.Author: PsychoKnight
Reviews.Content: Place offers ideal entertainment once the wife and kids are put down for their very long afternoon nap. Unlike other clubs, business here picks up to an energetic pace in the mid-afternoon with just the right level of crowd flow and there is always a good number of very doable dancers. Oh, the full-range breakfast buffet is pretty good, especially convenient when traveling with several young children and a fussy/uncooperative wife.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn exceeded my event and hotel expectations.”
Reviews.Author: furry_mason
Reviews.Content: I held my running club's annual Christmas party in the banquet room and everything was great. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was set up when I got there and the staff helped me rearrange anything I needed. The General Manager, Ana is great. She kept in touch with me from the day I first went to the hotel until after the party was over. The rooms were nice and very clean. I plan on having the party at the Hampton Inn again next year. Hot breakfast is included with your room.

Reviews.Title: “non-non-smoking”
Reviews.Author: EllenandDavidC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a courtyard enclosed on all sides by three floors of rooms with balconies. The hotel advertises itself as “nonsmoking,” but it’s not true. People are permitted to smoke all they want on the balconies, blowing smoke into what is essentially the confined space of the small courtyard. If you are sleeping in a room with a balcony, someone on the next balcony ten feet away can be puffing away any time of the day or night. If you like fresh air, as my wife and I do, and on nice nights sleep with the sliding door open, be prepared to sleep with the stench of second hand smoke. I asked management about this policy, rather strange in a “nonsmoking” hotel, and they said they allow smoking on the balconies because people smoke whether they’re allowed to or not. Hmm. Isn’t this like your city telling you they took out the traffic lights because people sometimes run them? Other than that, it’s a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME, helpful staff, cozy beds, and GREAT location - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Kathyjune
Reviews.Content: We are are a team of walkers, crew and cheerleaders for the Susan G Komen 3-Day and have stayed at your Hampton Inn during the event the past three years. All of the staff go out of their way to accommodate our needs - especially our last visit. It was a very rainy weekend. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay but be aware”
Reviews.Author: KentandJess
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. The staff extremely pleasant and helpful. The walls in the room were quite thin. We could hear our neighbours tv, although a quick call to the desk fixed that. I hate to have to say this, but the cooked breakfast was inedible. It made a whole new definition for the word "food". Fresh waffles & fruit saved the day though. There is no actual restaurant for dinner or lunch at the hotel (not a bad thing when I consider the egg & cheese omelet). There is a Denny's across the road fortunately. There are rooms located around the ice machines & vending machines. Make sure you are not in those rooms. Mark it on your booking. Fortunately we were not in one of those rooms. If the walls were thin, the doors are almost amplifiers. I would hate to be in one of those rooms in the early hours when someone gets some ice. It'd be bad enough with the noise they make just staying cold. Overall, a nice motel and about what you could expect from an average motel. Nice pool and spa pool. Marine training base pushes up the price of all accommodation in San Diego over the weekend as they have a graduation every Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, affordable conference room!”
Reviews.Author: San_Diego_MBA
Reviews.Content: Given the economy, my company is like everyone else''s... looking for ways to cut back on cost. We recently booked a two-day event at the Hampton Inn's conference room. The rates were fair and they, unlike most hotels, let you bring your own food in, which saved us over $300 easily. The conference room was spacious, had all the AV capabilities we were looking for, and they had a very kind, attentive staff. I would definitely recommend this for low-cost conference room booking, without sacrificing on quality.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and spacious.”
Reviews.Author: seattlevb
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located hotel at the end of I-8 literally. Hotel was accommodations are clean, ample space in each room and comfortable. We had a team stay there and the rooms were comfortable for our players. Only knock was I was told LCD TVs existed in the rooms but they really only are found in their king rooms ( very spacious ) and making photocopies was very expensive. Otherwise service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rate, free parking, horrible beds, so-so location”
Reviews.Author: YYZflytoomuch
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. You'll trade a horrible bed - it is springy with NO support at all - and a location amongst the homeless living in their beat-up motor homes for a well priced stay with free parking. Do yourself a favour and head over to Old Town and stay at the Holiday Inn Express or Courtyard. This is NOT your typical Hampton Inn. I am amazed that the brand would allow this 25 year old property to carry their signage. What ever happened to brand identity? The breakfast buffet and color scheme match but that is where it ends. I can't say enough about how bad the mattress was; soft, springy and no support at all. It feels 25 years old even though the staff tells me all the bedding is new. If the beds are new, they are not Hampton Inn issue. No attempt to address the issue when I complained (twice) about it either.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: anotherVaBeachGal
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for a small business meeting. The Hampton Inn Old Town / Sea World was the perfect choice! The staff made sure all of our attendees were happy and made a point of exceeding our expectations. The meeting space was comfortable and well equipped. The location is convenient to everything. The complimentary airport transfer was quick and easy to locate. We will definitely use this property again when we meet next time in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: maipl
Reviews.Content: I usually like staying at the HI and this was no exception, but we had a few hiccups. When we arrived the room smelled something terrible, so we had to move rooms. This was a quick procedure for the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “A different Hampton Inn!”
Reviews.Author: rayu66
Reviews.Content: I often use Hampton Inns during my trips. So I was surprised that this one was different.
