Not only a different building, alos the rooms were not at the same level I am used from other Hampton Inn hotels. The hotel is not bad, it´s quite charming, but it is simply different. If you want to go to Seaworld (only!) it is a good laocation, otherwise not. A couple of restaurants and supermarkets are near by, you can easily walk there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with fair value and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: chargers713
Reviews.Content: My family of three (15 year old son) stayed here for three nights from thursday until sunday and really liked this hampton. It looks really new as the lobby is very large and spacious and the rooms are nice. The beds are extremely comfortable and very quiet. It is very close to several local attractions such as the beach, Sea World, Old Town, Sports Arena, and Downtown/Airport. I really enjoyed the fact that the breakfast, parking, and wireless internet in the room and lobby were all complimentary. There was also complimentary coffee and tea 24 hours in the lobby. The swimming pool and hot tub was relaxing and clean and the staff was very friendly. We stayed in a 2 Queen Bed Deluxe for $129 a night and it was very fair priced. There are also several nearby restaurants and fast food places such as Olive Garden, In N Out, Denny's, Del Taco, Rubios, Subway, and Phil's BBQ (one of the best restaurants in SD - only about a mile away). The area is better and safer than it seems. The only negative was that there was no view from our rooms, but we didn't mind too much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bed as all Hampton Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Guidoncio
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and accommodations. The location is regular, some fast food chains nearby, near San Diego Sports Arena and some strip clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: joseph1963
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, there were a couple of problems with the room, but the front desk sent a maintenance man immediately to address both quickly. He even brought us a bag of candy for our troubles! The rate was excellent-$89 and the room was large. We could even see the Sea World fireworks from the window. The hotel is large and spread out but not a problem. Location was good - near airport, Point Loma and not far from Sea World. The Olive Garden and Red Lobster were good restaurants nearby. Point Loma Seafoods was excellent with reasonable prices. Corvette Grill was great with 50's era Corvette, movies, menu and waitresses dress. A tip: buy Sea World tickets online for a $10 savings.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Hampton Inns”
Reviews.Author: westashleyguy
Reviews.Content: I had a really nice stay here. I'm pretty sure this wasn't originally a Hampton Inn but was converted to one. It's still a very decent hotel. Very big and open lobby. Very friendly check-in and out. My room was fine, nothing special, but very clean. The area around the hotel is industrial as noted. I never noticed any problems. There are lots of places to eat close by. The breakfast seemed a little better than the standard Hampton Inn. Wireless throughout the hotel woks well. They have a couple computers in the lobby to use. There are right in the open though, so everyone can see what you're doing. Parking is a little tight. When I came back late one night, I had to park next door at the Denny's. They had told me that ahead of time that sometimes it does get full. No big deal, at least they warned me. And, it's free parking!

Reviews.Title: “THIS is a Hilton property? I don't see how...”
Reviews.Author: debbyem
Reviews.Content: The Hilton name means nothing any more. I have always trusted that Hilton properties would meet a certain basic level of expectations. This hotel has proven me wrong! In all ways, this hotel is a Comfort Inn or Days Inn, with the Hampton Inn name slapped on it. TERRIBLE!!! DO NOT waste your money. And, it's not as convenient to Sea World as advertised. Parking is ridiculous. They don't even have enough parking for one vehicle per room. Outrageous. Forget getting the room you reserved. We reserved a room with a sofa bed, refrigerator and microwave. And, yes, we booked this way in advance of our trip. When we arrived, we got a room with two beds, a desk and a TV - no sofa bed, no refrig and no MW. They were "out" of those rooms and "out" of refrigs to even send to the God forsaken room we ended up in. It is 2am and I should be comfortably sleeping in my Hilton property hotel room, but cannot get to sleep because of a literally constant noise coming from the elevator, which is next to our room. I've stayed in hotel rooms next to elevators before, and never have I been kept awake all night by elevator noise. We're stuck here for two nights, since all of the decent hotels in the area are sold out. NEVER again will I stay in this hotel!! As a long time Hilton Honors member, and frequenter of the Hilton brand, I will be contacting Hilton's corporate headquarters when we get home. Save yourself the nightmare, and choose a better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “very quiet!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotelbum
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 queen beds room for 6 nights. When checking in, we asked to be put in a quiet room and got one on the 3rd floor(top) facing the back. During the whole stay, we didn't hear any noise from the parking lot nor any noise from people walking in the hallway. We slept like pigs!!!!! The lobby was very spacious and airy and there was tea/coffee/hot water 24/7. You can rest in the lobby anytime!!! Each morning we had great hot breakfast like...make your own waffles, pastries, bagels, bread, hot items are different everyday from sausages, ham, sausage patties to scrambled eggs and omelets. There's fruit salad and apples and bananas everyday plus cereals and oatmeal. Breakfast was delicious and can fill you up. Breakfast area was good size with about 8 to 9 round tables for 4 people, but there are also 7 more tables in the lobby area too. Front desk people were professional and friendly. When we had problems with the electrical outlet, repair person came within 5 minutes. Great job, Hampton!!! It shows that your guests is your priority!! However, the parking spaces are a bit tight but parking is free!!!!!The location of the hotel is just right off the freeway ramp and it could be hard to turn right into the hotel, So for a few times we didn't make the turn quick enough but had to go down the block and circle back. As to the neighborhood, it is a business/industrial area so you don't go strolling after dinner. There is a nude bar next block but you can't really see it from the hotel. In fact, we didn't hear any commotion at night at all. So, it's quite safe if anyone is concerned. There is a mall 2 blocks away if you need anything like Ross, Target, banks, Staples, etc. Lots of eateries nearby. Overall, we are happy with our stay at Hampton Inn. However, I wish a microwave and fridge could be provided in all rooms instead of deluxe rooms only.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mitsufan
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly and courteous especially the evening front desk manager. The location of the hotel is right off the freeway exit so getting in can be a bit dicey. As previously indicated, there are a couple of strip clubs a block away but we never felt unsafe and always managed to find a parking spot out front. The hotel is about 5 minutes from Sea World and 10-15 mintues from most tourist attractions including Downtown so it was very convenient. The comlimentary hot breakfast was delicious was different every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal...especially if you're going to the Sports Arena”
Reviews.Author: auntietat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn for 2 nights to see an event at the Sports Arena. Location to the Sports Arena is walking distance, but I wouldn't recommend walking alone in this neighborhood, especially at night. The hotel itself is very nice inside. Looks newly remodeled. The staff were very nice and when I requested a hypoallergenic pillow, it almost made it up to the room before I did! The room was very clean, with plenty of towels, comfortable bed, and for the most part quiet. The hair dryer is a bit clunky and looked kind of old, but worked fine. The only complaint I would have is that both mornings I woke up by the loud sound of my neighbor's shower turning on. Other than that, a pretty quiet hotel. I enjoyed the breakfast (and especially the coffee). They offer a huge variety...everything from Belgian waffles you make yourself to bagels, muffins, hot & cold cereal, fruit, eggs, potatoes and juice. One morning they had cheese omelets and turkey sausage, the next day they had scrambled eggs and ham. Also, the free parking was a plus. I was able to find a parking spot right in front of the lobby the entire stay. This hotel is great for: The business traveler (free wi-fi in the room, plus 2 computers for guest use in the lobby); families on a budget; and for people attending events at the Sports Arena.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place near Hotel Circle and Sea World”
Reviews.Author: heart
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a conference at nearby Town & Country Conference Center in the Hotel Circle region. This Hampton Inn was as expected: well-maintained building and a spacious room. Local neighborhood is not so great, but if you have a car and are just staying in the hotel, it will not matter. It takes just a few minutes to drive to the conference center at Hotel Circle on I-8. Wireless internet access in the room was OK but a bit slower than I have come to expect at a hotel. Overall a good value for the cost and I will be back for the next conference in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: OzDennyCrane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in October and had were mostly very happy with it. The location is just a few minutes drive to SeaWorld, which was the main reason I chose it. Sure the general area isn't ideal as other reviewers have pointed out, but we weren't wandering the streets at night so it wasn't a problem for us. The hotel is showing its age a little, but is generally very clean. We could clearly hear the people in the next room talking and people upstairs walking around, so that was a little annoying, but not too bad. The hotel has plenty of parking, also a guest laundry which was useful for us. Computers for internet access are available in the lobby. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the complimentary buffet breakfast was OK. We ate dinner at Dennys, which is just next door. We found the hotel to be good value and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but make sure you lock your doors”
Reviews.Author: az1969guy
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at many Hampton Inns overs the years all over the US. August 2009 we stayed at the Hampton Inn by the Empre State Building. Unfortunately, this stay in San Diego was a very big surprise. This was a bad experience for us. The hotel itself and the staff were almost up to normal standards. Friendly welcome, nice room, etc. The location is really bad. There is a nude bar fairly close. There are industrial businesses surrounding the area. Homeless walking the streets. Worse of all is trying to get in and out of the place. It is smack at the end of two freeway off ramps. Extremely dangerous. I don't blame the hotel itself for this, just the person that chose this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jadams444
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the opportunity to spend a few days in San Diego. We usually always stay at the Hampton. They are consistent, clean, and the staff is friendly and professional. So I didn't think twice about booking this Hampton Inn. Check in took all of about 45 seconds and the girl at check in was very friendly. We were allowed to get into the room early which allowed us to get an early start to our first day exploring. The breakfast area looked unusally large. Part of it was the back half of the main lobby. Very nice and clean. There were also large flat screen TV's mounted in both locations so you could watch the morning news, if you so desired. There were always enough tables to be seated, never having to wait. Each morning, a very well stocked breakfast buffet was set out with both hot and cold breakfast items, and several juices and coffees to choose from as well. In the evening, they set out cookies in the lobby for the guests as well. The lobby was very large with plenty of seating, along with two computers for guest use. There have tight parking spaces, which tend to fill up fast, and I believe in the summer when the hotel is full there would not be enough to accomodate all the cars. In December, that was not a problem. We always managed to park right at the front entrance every night . Nearby restaurants within walking distance are Denny's and Jackin'box and subway. Anything else you would have to drive to because the hotel in next to a freeway off ramp and not very safe to cross the road there. The four block drive to Old Town was worth the drive. Plenty of great restaurants there. We read other reviews about the Nude bar around the corner and were a little concerned. This hotel is located in a business district area so that has to be expected. We did not see any seedy people lurking about the whole time we were there. Actually we hardly saw anybody outside of the buildings when we drove by. To us it was no different than passing a large billboard advertising nude revues. It seemed to be a safe area. The location of the hotel however, was great !! Close to everything... with access to both major interstates. The only disappointing thing we encountered was that there was no microwave / mini fridge in the room. Overall, our five night stay was very nice and I would definitely recommend this hotel for a nice stay in the area. It's also about 1/2 the price of the downtown San Diego hotels for about a 15-minute's drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable, great service”
Reviews.Author: Peter_DKTucson_AZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights while enjoying a weekend in San Diego with my honey. Check-in on Friday night was quick and very pleasant; the ladies at the front desk were some of the nicest I've seen manning a desk late at night. We got upgraded to a deluxe room, which certainly made the stay extra sweet. Room was big, had balcony, couch, work area (but it was a weekend), and of course a very comfortable bed. Breakfast was impressive. I've stayed at other Hamptons, but this one had a great selection of both warm and cold foods. Service was attentive and even though the place was crowded, everything was stocked well. There is only one problem with this hotel which is parking on busy nights. The first night we found a few tight spots available, but the second night we had to park our convertible on the street. Fortunately, nothing happened but we did also clean out everything that could look interesting to thieves. Sure, there are some strip clubs nearby (you can't see them from the hotel), but the area wasn't scary. We didn't eat at any of the nearby restaurants, but Denny's is a stone's throw away. So is the freeway so it's easy to get here and go downtown. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: trvlgbebe
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to many attractions - 5 mins from Sea World/Mission bay, 25 mins to Las Americas premium outlets, 20 mins downtown, 45 mins Carlsbad outlet/Legoland. Exit to goto hotel is very fast, so pay attention to your directions! Not located in the greatest area with adult entertainment/bars a block away, but Target, several fast food est, Walgreens, and other restaurants are close by. Room was clean, king bed was comfy. Portable crib was not a pack-n-play, but a small crib on wheels. Daily breakfast was reasonable; hot entrees changed daily. Free internet access in the lobby, pool was small but clean, fitness room is a small room and not worth your time. Vending and ice machines on each floor. Parking is limited on the weekends. Staff are hit and miss in the friendliness department. But they were responsive and timely in meeting our requests. Would stay at this location again, due to its proximity to the attractions we visited and our familiarity of the area. As for the other businesses around the hotel, didn't bother us since we only were at the hotel to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Descent Hotel in not so descent location”
Reviews.Author: BoilerTip
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice during our 9-day trip to SOCAL area. Both times the staff got us early-check-ins (by several hours!) without any hassle. Rooms were clean and beddings were in good condition. Frontdesk staff were friendly although not all of them seem to be very forthcoming with information for the local tours. Paid Shuttle service to any local spots was reliable and friendly. Complimentary airport shuttle is great too but we got to the wrong hotel first (there is another Hampton inn in downtown) and have to pay our way to get to the right one. Our return trip to airport, hotel reserved a lcoal taxi (Greenride limaxi) which didn't show up. We somehow managed to get to the airpot barely making the flight - thanks to the regular airport shuttle driver who departed early on his scheduled trip to accomodate us. Free breakfast was good. The second time we checked in, we were given a room that had defective Air conditioner. When we called the frontdesk, maintenance personnel was dispatched right away who appeared to know beforehand (as he declared with barely looking a the machine) that the AC was dead! The satff kindly offered to switch me to another room but as it was already late with my little ones were in bed, I had to accept their next best offer - a fan. Somehow I got a feeling that this is not the first time they are doing this although I have no way of proving this. Another big factor that made us uncomfortable was the lcoation of the hotel. It sits very next to the freeway exit ramp making it difficult to cross the road by walk. Restaurants nearby are limited to Denny's and Jackin'box and subway. To get to other restaurants that are 2-blocks away, you have to cross an adult store (open 24-hours) and a strip joint - both are right across the hotel. I had great difficulty in diverting the attention of my curious little 6-yr old daughter when we walked/drove past the strip joint and the adult store. Although I have to mention that there were no loitering outside and no noticeable unpleasant activities in the area. Overall it is a good experience for us for the money we spent (less than 100 dollars/night) and I'll recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: ognyusa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is big & clean. As soon we walked in the lobby, we were amazed how big the lobby was. Check-in was easy & staffs were friendly. Room is pretty big w/ 2 queen size beds. Too bad no microfridge. Breakfast was good & staffs were very polite. Parking lot was crowd & the spaces between each car were narrow. There were several adult clubs 1-2 blocks away from the hotel. Other than that, It's close to all. Overall, nice hotel to stay if you are visiting San Diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience, The Group salesman is a Liar and a thief.”
Reviews.Author: Teamplaye
Reviews.Content: Beware, this hotel is advertised as a Kid friendly hotel, yet is located next to a low end strip club. We are a youth soccer club and all kinds of bad people walking around the area. The group salesman conned us into booking 20 rooms which he promised would have 2 beds, when we arrived, there were only rooms with a king and a twin pullout. We had 20 families with multiple kids and the parents had to sleep on the hard floor due to the lack of extra beds. There were tons of other complaints, wet floors in the rooms, keys not working, families with reservations were told that their reservation had been deleted. Our coach got stuck in the elevator for 10 mins with his infant daughter. The front desk staff was extremely rude. We were called liars when we addressed the issue about the rooms. an overall horrible experience. A transient was even hit by a car due to traffic comming from the freeway. There are plenty of other good hotels in the area. dont waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!! Highly Recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: tynerj
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 7/18-7/21, and it really lived up to my expectations. A little difficult to get in and out of, but a WONDERFUL property!! Spacious rooms, close to Seaworld, Cabrillo, bayfront...AWESOME! Breakfast was great and felt very safe and comfortable there. Olive Garden, Chick-Fil-A, In N' Out, Panda Express, Walgreens, and a lot of others very close. Denny's right across the street, but never tried. Made me feel very welcome and comfortable---staff was great...really IMPRESSED!!! THANKS, I WILL BE BACK!!

Reviews.Title: “It worked out well”
Reviews.Author: DayTripper1026
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive reviews on TA and after finding availability during the busy month of July at a good price, I decided to roll the dice. Glad I did. This turned out to be a good choice for us. It was close to everything. We took advantage of the convenient location of both Denny's and Jack in the Box. Breakfast was VERY good. Since we were back in kind of early and just walked across the street for dinner, we never had an issue with the parking. If I can find the same value again I'd definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: CoachSr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group (six rooms) May 23-26 and enjoyed it all. Beautiful lobby, wonderful breakfast area and food service, and helpful front desk. Within walking distance to Old Town Trolley and bus stops two blocks away if you have to walk. Denny's and Jack-in-the-Box across the driveway. A few blocks from Sports Arena, but we were doing the beach and Sea World. About a 15 minute bus ride from Sea World. Great selection of fruit, bagels, biscuits, eggs, sausage, cereal, milk, juice, coffee for breakfast. Only downside seemed to be thin walls and we could hear other rooms tv and conversations into the night. Not bad, but noticeable enough. Very spread out layout and you can walk forever from the lobby to one of the back side rooms. Elevators helped, but it was still a long way. Families and business people stayed here while we were here. Packed out Sunday morning! Tuesday morning (after the Memorial Day holiday) hardly anyone- one group of business people had a meetin over breakfast with three tables pushed together and going over their paperwork and planning. It was fine, no problem, but they would not be able to do this over the weekend I guess due to the weekend crowd. Our stay was fine thanks to clean rooms, very comfortable beds, and helpful staff. I did not like the area proximity to the nude bars on the next block, but there was no problem. All over San Diego there are homeless people and we did run into a couple of them here and there in this area near Sports Arena. Other plusses are stores close by - Walgreens, Big Lots, In-n-Out Burger, Chick-Fil-A, Chucky Cheese, and many more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel all around.”
Reviews.Author: DavidCP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 days, April 2009, for vacation. We love San Diego and wanted to get away for a relaxing trip before our second baby comes this summer. After much searching on the internet we decided to book with this Hotel based on its price, free breakfast/parking, and location. The location is great, tucked right off the highway (5), easy access to the highways, and relatively close to the beaches. There are lots of restaurants and fast food nearby, as well as a Target for little things. The Breakfasts were great, plenty of food. Staff was awesome. Andrew at the front desk was very helpful, both while booking a nice room and for little things along the way. Stuff to do nearby: MIssion Beach, Watch the sunset at Sunset Cliffs, Sea World, Shopping. The only thing to watch out for is the nudie bar a few blocks away. It did not intrude at all on the stay, but not something I would want to drive by with my kids everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Good value despite the, ummm...local entertainment”
Reviews.Author: littleyacht
Reviews.Content: This was one hotel I didn't check Trip Advisor for before I left home. We needed an overnight stay near the airport after a late night arrival into San Diego. I'm glad I didn't because I would have been put off by the notice of the strip club down the block and would have missed a good deal. The hotel is just what you expect from a Hampton...clean, friendly and serving a good breakfast. Yes, when we arrived after midnight, the "LIVE! NUDE GIRLS LIVE! sign was lit up like NY on a Saturday night, but I travel with teenagers and I have to admit, they found the whole situation hysterical. As other reviewers have noted, the business is not indicative of the area. It's typical of downtown San Diego...very mixed depending on what block you're on. If I was staying in San Diego for a week, no, I wouldn't stay here. I don't know where the folks from the strip club are hanging out after leaving. But for a night or two, it's just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Older but nicely updated and excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: davej34
Reviews.Content: Exceptional value for San Diego. Perfect location for Sea World. Area only slightly seedy but totally safe appearing--commercial area. Very nicely updated rooms, clean, comfortable. Impressive lobby, usual great Hampton breakfast, nice pool and very accommodating staff. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A riddle...”
Reviews.Author: Mac_Maximum
Reviews.Content: What do you find between a freeway and a stripclub? Ahh..that would be Hampton Inn Sea World of course?!? Yes, that is not part of the website. How awesome is that, a strip club literally within a block and half from your hotel front door. The rooms were nice, pool and jacuzzi all-right, the weight room a bit tiny, and the food a bit okay. But for 99 bucks a night, I can't complain too much. Close to the beach, and Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in So So Area”
Reviews.Author: taprennoc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hampton Inn several times in the last few years and have never been disappointed with the hotel or rooms. And since they have just finished a remodeling of the rooms and lobby, it is even better. I am fairly certain all the rooms have recevied new carpet, bathroom vanities, and furniture. The Hampton Bedding is really good. The pool area looks nice although I have never used it. The breakfast area is nice, spacious, and an adequate breakfast is included. I took a few pictures this last visit and have posted them here. The ONLY real downfall to the hotel is the super tight parking spaces, which tend to fill up fast, and I believe when the hotel is full there are not enough to accomodate all the cars. And yes there is a strip club on the corner of the block, but I have never seen or heard any commotion coming from the area. There are plenty of restaurants nearby - In & Out, Del Taco, Chick Fil A, Sizzler, Dennys, Panda Express and Burger king from what I can recall. I am sure there are some other brands that are not fast food style near by. Also there is a TJ Maxx and other shopping just down the road. Stay Here. i am sure you wont be disappointed. Only about 10 minutes to Airport, 12 minutes from Downtown GasLamp district, and 5 minutes from Sea World. Also, be aware they offer a AAA discount, but you have to ask for it when making the reservation or it is not offered. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: roadtriper1
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn Sea World is a nice place to stay. This hotel is conveiniently located close to Sea World and Belmont Park/Mission Beach. The hotel staff was excellent and friendly and the hot breakfast great. They have a nice pool too. The rooms aren't brand new but, are clean and comfortable. The only complaint is that the parking is very tight with limited spaces available. They do offer overflow parking directly across the street in the Denny's parking lot. If you are visiting Sea World or the surrounding area, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Place”
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our recent weekend stay at this Hampton. I didn't mind the location. Sea World was less than 5 minutes away taking the back streets. We stayed in room 101. At first I was a little disappointed because we requested a top floor room. None were available at the time of check in. We loved room 101. It's tucked back in a quiet little corner. We loved that room. It was clean and quiet. We would hear the occasional noisy motorcycle or car go by on the freeway but it wasn't that big of a deal. The breakfast attendents aren't very friendly, maybe part of it is that they can barely speak English...maybe they don't understand. We've stayed at several Hamptons this summer and all the breakfast attendents are usually very nice and friendly. Not at this Hampton. Our weekend rate was $129 a night, great price for San Diego on the weekend. The pool area is tiny but sufficient. This is really a nice place. I would definately recommend to others. From reading previous reviews I had pictured the "adult" entertainment area being right across the street. You can't see it from the hotel. Yes, you'll more than likely drive by it but it had no effect on the hotel or our stay. Unfortunately, there are places like this in every town that I've driven by...just another establishment. My daughter, who's ten, didn't even notice. No big deal.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: 4Smiles
Reviews.Content: The first thing that you see when you you walk in the hotel is the nice lobby area! The staff is nice and willing to lend a helping hand! Our key card did not open from the outside and a hotel employee was ready to help out. The front desk even checked if we made it to our room safely. What a plus! The room was very clean and perfect to the tea! You can tell that this hotel has beed remodeled and well-maintained with staff always seen cleaning in the hotel. There was even an employee that greeted everyone in the lobby/dining area during breakfast. Nice smile! Overall- my family and I were very impressed with everything from the room to the delicious breakfast. We would have stayed another night, but we had to hit the beaches in and around the LA area! If youa re in the San Diego area, stay here -- you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “High Quality, Fresh, Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: 2112ps
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in April 2008 and the whole hotel(lobby, rooms, pool, breakfast area, and grounds are fresh, clean up-to-date, and nicely furnished. As a previous poster said that the rooms are 70's and worn is not the case. The rooms have been recently renovated( new carpet, furniture, beds/bedding, T.V.'s, granite bathrooms, ect . A good percentage of the rooms have balconys also. The pool/spa area is above average for a Hampton Inn. The front desk staff are friendly and accomodating. The area around the hotel does have a strip-club but also has a Target, Chilis, Olive garden, Ralph's grocery store, Vons Grocery Store, among others. It is a bussiness district. Sea World is about 3-4 miles away. Pacific Beach is about 5 miles away. Old Town is 1 mile away. Downtown San Diego is 5-6 miles away. I highly recommend for a $140-$170 a night rate. Also included is free breakfeast buffet including hot items, free internet computers in lobby, free airport shuttle, free daily USA today newspaper (M-F), free coffee/tea in lobby 24 hrs. a day. If you do not have a car, you may want to stay elsewhere as the hotel is in a bussiness district, but it is not too far from most attractions and points of interest via a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: CNorm
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, I had to scramble to find an adequate place to stay that was both near the airport and cruise pier before our cruise mid-April. Originally, we were booked into another hotel that was undergoing heavy construction/renovation and had awful reviews on this website. Glad I found this Hampton Inn. It had just finished undergoing a major renovation and it was hopping with many a pre-cruise clientele. Our room was very nice...large, nice decor, comfy beds, spacious and quiet. The complimentary breakfast buffet was very good and plentiful. For an added plus, there was free internet access at two (brand new) computers in the lobby. We also had complimentary airport and cruise pier shuttle service. There was also a small, but adequate enough, fitness room with brand new equipment. Had a good workout, so can't complain. The area in which the hotel is located is rather so-so (some adult entertainment venues....but remember that San Diego sees a lot of sailors looking for a good time), but there was a Denny's (which actually wasn't a dive!) a 2-minute walk away that suited our purpose for dinner the night before our cruise. Honestly, I wouldn't stay at this hotel if I was in San Diego for a length of time, but for a night or two, it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value for Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: socalady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2008. This hotel is very dated. The furnishings are older and the wallpaper in the rooms is peeling. We requested a room with a microwave and refrigerator and the room was suprisingly large. The pool is located in a center courtyard and I don't know if it is heated. We did not use the pool during our stay. There are lots of fast food restaurants close by. Jack In the Box and Denny's were both walking distance although I wouldn't walk around the neighborhood at night because I am not familiar with it and do not know how safe it is. Also, the hotel is across the street from a nude strip club and I wouldn't feel comfortable strolling among their patrons. The free breakfast in the morning was typical continental (muffins, toast, cereal) with one hot item (breakfast pizzas) that none of my family liked. We ate the fresh fruit, yogurt and cereal. I would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and coming for an activity or specific San Diego attraction but if you will be spending a lot of time in your hotel room then I would recommend paying a little more and staying somewhere nicer and more modern.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable -reasonable priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcme4
Reviews.Content: The location is close to all major vacation places. The Hotel is clean and the staff is very good. The price is right. The only downside is that the area is more business aka not a resort. What you save in hotel expenses more than makes up for the location. It is not great but it is not bad. .Slightly above average for a Hampton- nice lobby/typical rooms. No micro wave or frid... but bought a cheap cooler for my beer/wine. Again, very close to everything. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location not as bad as some claim”
Reviews.Author: txgmc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn-Sea World area during a long weekend trip to S.D. this past weekend. San Diego is a great city to visit, although personally I could never live there unless I was rich and had a boat. As for the Hampton Inn, this particular one is not the nicest in the network, but it definitely is about average for what this consistent hotel chain offers. To begin with, regarding the location, it is not bad at all. The hotel is set off of a main street right off of I-8, and down the street a bit happens to be a strip club. Big deal - it's a military town. Coming & going after midnight, we felt completely safe. Near the strip club there's a Starbucks and In-N-Out burger as a matter of fact. Parking is a nightmare if you arrive back on the late side. The room we had (referred to as a deluxe room by the check-in rep) was on the large side. Apparently we got a comp upgrade from the regular non-smoking king room that was reserved, according to the rep. We had a first floor room with a patio overlooking the pool area. Furnishings/carpet/accessories were modern and comfortable. The mattress was a Serta perfect sleeper (I prefer the Serta monitor series). Yes, I stay at a lot of Hampton inns. Their mattresses are great! The rest of the property was fine too. Breakfast was excellent as usual, considering that it's complimentary. All employees we came into contact with were nice. There are two Dell computers with a color printer in the lobby for anyone to use. Overall, those choosing to stay here will experience a consistent Hampton Inn with no surprises. Yes, there's a strip club down the street, but that does not necessarily mean unsafe or bad area. The location is very central to all of S.D. and really cannot be beat for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: irishmike7
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a balcony, great room, great internet service, staff very professional. Never heard the train I have read on oher reviews. The location, at least for us, was perfect, minutes away form the zoo, Mission Beach and not too far from downtown and the harbor. I was in the Navy here in the early seventies and I was able to drive all over the city as if I had never left. and find my way back here with no problem. There is a strip club about two blocks form the hotel (Les GIrls, it was there when I was a young sailor) but I didn';t see a lot of strippers in the lobby so it was kind of a non issue. Great pool, Great hot breakfasts in the morning and we will be staying here again in July. Oh, and if you like Jack in the Box tacos there is one within feet of the hotel.(I lived on them things when I was in the Navy and we have no Jack in the Box where I live, so it was kind of a big deal to me).

Reviews.Title: “A fine overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoBroon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton overnight before a cruise. We read the previous reviews and were prepared for the neighborhood. There are indeed strip clubs in close proximity to the hotel, but since we only there overnight, we spent all our time in the hotel and weren't impacted by any seediness. There is also a Denny's across the street, but we didn't eat there. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly and check in was quick. Our room was convenient to the elevator and had a small balcony with chairs. Our room overlooked a courtyard, so I can't comment on the previous reports of noise. The bed was the usual comfortable Hampton Inn bed and had a lap desk, sitting area and regular desk. The shower had great water pressure and plenty of towels, although the towels were kept outside of the bathroom and I didn't notice this until already in the shower. We enjoyed the free Internet access and hot breakfast. They also had breakfast bags to take with you, although we did not get any on this trip. We used the laundry facilities and found them clean and well maintained. The free parking was also a plus, although the lot is small and I can imagine how it would fill up if the hotel was at capacity. For our purpose - a place to sleep and wash clothes before leaving on a cruise - the hotel was great. I would stay here again on an overnight trip, but would probably seek out a hotel with a more pedestrian friendly neighborhood for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “No integrity and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: snake1mgm
Reviews.Content: I am military and I travel to San Siego often. This was my first stay in the Hampton Inn San Diego, Sea World and it was one one of the worst experiences of my life. I arrived late to the hotel due to a connecting flight being cancelled. The receptionist was very nice and told me she would not charge me for the room. When I got my receipt, the room charge for that day was not listed. However, when I got the bill, I had been charged. I called the manager several times who said he would look into it but never called me back. As a military member, I was not paying for the hotel room but I am still a little upset that they chose not to tell me the truth. I nor my troops will ever stay at this facility again!

Reviews.Title: “Not great, especially for the value”
Reviews.Author: NYCroadtrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, and found the hotel was not worth $179/night. We didn't find the area seedy (more strip malls than strip joints), there's plenty of fast food around, and you're a short drive from the beach. However, the rooms, although big and clean, had very thin walls so you can hear your neighbors' TV. The bathroom was a bit musty, and the tub had a rubber bathmat. Finally, their fitness center is outdated and smells bad. Overall, not terrible, but definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Hampton San Diego Airport Area”
Reviews.Author: Dutchboy135
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been totally renovated and is a pleasure to stay here. I had stayed here 2 years prior and this time the whole expereince was excellent right from check in. The front office staff were very helpful in recommending places to eat and things to do. Rooms were very clean and the beds are unbelievably comfortable. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sisu6
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice when we have come to visit our son at the University of San Diego. WE had booked at a Days Inn and were horrified at how disgusting it was. We canceled our reservations and drove to Hampton Inn. They were so accommodating with no reservations and gave us a deluxe room with a discount. Rooms are beautiful, comfortable, clean and large. Our room had a small refrig, micro and coffee pot. We had our two teenagers with us. The breakfast is wonderful. We had sausage, eggs, biscuits, bagels, muffins, fresh fruit, cereal, O.J, milk, coffee,and tea. We will stay here again when our son graduates next year. I do agree that it can be noisy if you have loud people above- but I always bring earplugs. But not enough noise to cancel stay. We have always felt safe. Denny's is across the street and shopping is very close. Parking can be difficult if you arrive late.

Reviews.Title: “Appearances Can Be Decieving...”
Reviews.Author: DLPrincess
Reviews.Content: Wow, appearances can be very decieving. Upon arriving, my family and I were impressed with the way that the Hampton Inn itself looked, but ended up being very disapointed by the end of our 4 night trip. Here, I will take a look at some of the pros and cons of staying at the Hampton Inn, San Diego (near Sea World). PROS: 1. The hotel was nicely furnished. The foyer sort of had an upscale hotel feel to it. There were lots of places to relax and a TV to watch. The rooms were decorated very nicely with dark wood headboards and had nice stonework in the showers. The comforters were these amazing pure white down comforters and they were very nice to sleep under. The hotel kitchen/breakfast area was nicely decorated and the paint on the inside and outside of the hotel as kept up. Everything looked really, really nice. 2. A complimentary breakfast was served. The hotel staff prepared brown lunch bags for "breakfast on the go" for hotel Guests. Inside was a muffin, apple, bottled water, breakfast bar and some other yummy goodies. The hotel also had other breakfast items available in the kitchen. There was an egg, ham and cheese dish, as well as cereal and milk. The "breakfast on the go" bags were served on the weekends, while the other breakfast items were served during the weekdays. 3. The staff was incredibly helpful and nice. Several staff members went out of their way to make sure that my family's needs were taken care of. Extra sheets and blankets were given quickly and there was an air of a "can-do" attitude from almost everyone. There is one gentleman that stood out above the rest. I cannot remember his name, but he has curly hair and it tall and was the nicest front office clerk that I've ever encountered on a hotel stay. He was very helpful--if you ever stay at the Hampton, look to him for help--he's terrific! :) 4. There are extra commodities. There is a nice pool that attracted a decent sized crowd every night. There is also a pretty nice gym near the foyer of the hotel. There is a kitchen and also plenty of places to "lounge" around the hotel--places to sit and read a newspaper or book. 5. Secure doors. The hotel requires that you use a key card to gain entry in and out of the hotel itself, which provides an extra measure of security. 6. Great housecleaning people. The rooms were always kept completely clean and how they keep those white comforters looking so white baffles me! :) They are really excellent at what they do! CONS: 1. Doors. The doors do not have stripping at the bottom and there is about a 1" gap underneath each door, so lots of noise tends to come in underneath it. 2. Walls/Floors. The walls were a little thin, so you could hear conversations going on in the next room when people were talking loud. We had a family with lots of children staying in the rooms above us and you could hear them running back and forth all night on the first night that we stayed there. 3. Area. The area around the hotel is a little seedy. Once you're inside the hotel, you feel pretty safe, but outside, you feel a little vulnerable. There are some strip clubs about 1 block away (right around the corner from the Denny's) and it's lit up with big neon letters. Down the street from the hotel, the streets are not lighted very well. The gate at the back of the parking lot (around the back of the hotel) is kept open during the day until 10:00 at night. There were several times that my family went out to our cars and we saw some interesting, scruffy looking people. It made you feel like you wanted to get into your car quickly, or at least be a little more vigilent. 4. Maintenance. Perhaps the biggest inconvenience on our trip was that we had to unpack and switch rooms every single night during our stay, except for the last one. The nightmare began on the first day, when the toilet in one of our two rooms started leaking out water everywhere. Towels were put down and the front desk was called. The front desk said that the toilet could not be fixed that day because the plumber was gone. They arranged for us to have another new room. However, the new room only held one King sized bed and we had 8 people in our party. A portion of our party took the new, smaller room, while another portion, moved into the leaky toilet room and the other into the good room. (We had an elderly person traveling with us and it is easy for her to slip--the water on the floor was definitely a hazard for her). The next day, the front desk sent a plumber to fix the problem. He said that it was a minor problem with a hose and that he could fix it quickly. However, when we came back to the hotel later in the day, we discovered that the entire toilet was missing!!! There was a big hole in the ground and black stuff on the tile around it. Everytime the toilet in the next room flushed, the hole in the ground made this awful gurgling sound, threatening to spew up some concoction of toilet goo. (Thankfully, it never actually did!!) The hotel offered us yet another new hotel room and the people in the leaky toilet room moved down the hall into the new room. Thinking that our maintenance wohs were over, we breathed a sigh of relief. Only, the maintenance troubles didn't end there. On the third night, at 3:53 in the morning, both my sister and I woke up to hear a very loud and awful rattling coming from the air conditioning unit! We laughed because we found it hilarious (in a weird way), that there was a problem with every single room we'd had. I lightly hit the unit and the rattling stopped....until about an hour later when it started up again. This continued several more times, almost every hour, until I whacked it really hard and kicked it and the rattling (not the air conditioning unit) finally stopped for good. The next morning, I discovered that the shower head was also broken, roar! Needless to say, with all the switching around, the poor maintenance, damaged toilet, broken showerhead, kids running upstairs, and rattling air conditioning unit, we didn't get much sleep. I came home feeling less rested than when I'd first come to the hotel, even though I was on vacation. Our family missed out on several events and locations because we spent so much time each day, switching our items back and forth to the new hotel rooms. 5. Beds. This might just be a picky thing, but the beds were really, really soft. I have a bad back and so did another one of our travelers and it didn't do either of us any favors. If you have a bad back, this may not be the hotel for you. 6. Warm/Hot Hallways. The hallway doors leading to the pool outside were kept open during our stay, making for toasty hallways and a gigantic mosquito on the wall. OVERALL IMPRESSION: Because of the poor maintenance and the horrible lack of sleep and lost vacation time due to our room problems, I would say that I won't ever be coming back to this hotel again. My family agrees with my decision. However, if the Hampton were to up it's maintenance program and make sure that the rooms were kept in tip-top order, then I'd re-consider. Until though, we will not be returning to the Hampton by Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-range hotel, not such a good location”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTraveler2
Reviews.Content: The directions to the Hampton Inn are pretty simple. You turn at the 2 strip clubs. They have very large signs – you can’t miss them. Given the location, it’s a good thing that the Hampton Inn is it’s own oasis in the city once you’re inside. The lobby / gathering area has a somewhat piano-bar type feel, but it’s fine. The garden courtyard is very well done, and the pool is well maintained and of a reasonable size. All rooms are on the interior halls. (Some, however, are right above the lobby / eating area, and would probably be too loud if you wanted to sleep in.) The room was spacious and comfortable. Everything was clean. Parking is free. The oddest thing about the room is the outlets. The receptacles were too wide for standard-issue plugs. They would fit, but loosely. This affected not only our various electronic devices, but also the property’s own items. An overhead light, for example, had a hard time staying plugged in. Opening the bathroom door too quickly could cause the microwave to become unplugged (there’s no door stop for the bathroom door). It does come with a microwave, a larger than typical refrigerator, and a coffee maker. The standard Hampton breakfast is provided: Almost-fresh fruit salad, cereal, bagels, marginally edible hot item, etc. It’s free and nice to have, but certainly not spectacular. Free wireless network was quick and easy to use. In the immediate neighborhood, there are the 2 strip clubs, a rent-a-Harley place, a bicycle store, a scrapbook store, a “quick divorce” legal office, a Dennys restaurant, and a Jack in the Box. You can create your own story about how to combine the services of the different businesses. I’d hesitate before staying here again. The room was clean and comfortable, the property interior was attractive, but I don’t need an oasis in the city. I liked San Diego and would prefer to be able to walk to its attractions, instead of having to get in the car every time I wanted to do something.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Hampton!”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior1958
Reviews.Content: Family stayed at this Hampton March 23 - March 27 2007. Delightful! Very clean , great service and people that care! Great pool & hot tub. There were four of us (2 A, and a 9 and 14 yr old). Daily hot breakfast did not always include eggs, but had a couple hot items daily (ie waffles & sausages, bagels & eggs, eggs etc.), in additiion there was a range of cereals, toast, bagels, jam, jelly, creamcheese, butter - well done! Pool area had a very hot hottub, which was great after a long day at seaworld! Daughter: "Pool rocked Daddy" Area not that great for walks, as its industrial, on edge of retail. Very close to Old town, lots of retail, outlet stores (Mission Valley), and high fashion (Fashion Valley). Room very clean & nice, soft bed, lots of assorted pillows, desk, view etc. Couldn't get out of bed - too comfortable! Free parking, high speed internet (code at front), Large property, bit of a hike to the front. Just wrapping up renos when we were there so very clean, nice & new! Paid $97 - $112 / night AAA rate. Overall very, very nice - or as my daughter cheers,

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel - sketchy location”
Reviews.Author: jaimeeg
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel while on an overnight stay to San Diego. The hotel itself is nice enough, but the location is not the best. If I were to have seen the location prior to booking, I most likely would have stayed elsewhere. There is another hotel right next door that looks like it might house some questionable characters, and we had to enter right next to the other hotel's parking lot. Kinda scary for three women... The lobby and eating area of the hotel were very nice and clean, and the breakfast was well-stocked and fresh. Our room was clean but not as spacious as most Hampton Inn rooms. We were at the extreme back of the hotel, and there were several long hallways to walk down to get up to the lobby area. It seemed kind of dreary and dark in the hallways. The bathroom area of our room was clean, but the sink area was quite small, especially with the coffee pot sitting on the countertop. Overall, the stay was fine. I would most likely find a different area if in San Diego again, but we slept well and were safe!

Reviews.Title: “Blood stained sheet for Halloween?”
Reviews.Author: plan4life
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before for a hotel stay, but I feel compelled to issue a strong warning to those considering this facility. As a regular business traveler and Hampton Inn guest, I was shocked to find bed linens which had spots of dried blood. This was discovered late Sunday evening, after returning from dinner. It was too late to check out and the hotel's security guard delivered the replacement sheets for me to change at midnight. This Hampton Inn is currently undergoing remodeling and the rooms do not have the typical upgrades characteristic of almost all Hampton Inns. No wireless interenet (wires required), very old and beat up furnishings, no arm chair or sofa, dirty windows and a stale smell which permeated the room. Once the general manager came on duty Monday AM , I presented the situation of the sheets and he promptly apologized and offered the night on the house. I take no issue with the staff, but the property is very below par for Hampton Inns and my room rate for 2 queens with no balcony was $139, hardly a bargain when considering the hotel condition and the surrounding area which is primarily strip clubs, Goodwill and Salvation Army outlets and fast food joints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: chainoil
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here at the end of August for 3 nights. The hotel was very clean. The staff was great when we needed anything. There was free internet in the lobby that my son loved. The continental breakfast was a terrific way to start our day. My only complaint was the location. Its a busy area especially during rush hour traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Satisfing”
Reviews.Author: tonni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton for 2 nights during our sons graduation from MCRD. It is way overpriced, we payed $136.00 per night and the room was very average, small, one queen bed a desk and a chair, I expected more. When we checked in the clerk couldnt find our reservations, she set us up in a room that was already occupied so when we went in there was another family already there, how embarrasing.There were no towels at the pool but the pool was very nice, clean well kept. Continental breakfast was also good but all tables were sticky. For a hotel that assures 100% satisfaction gauranteed, it wasnt all that satisfing.

Reviews.Title: “I Overpaid”
Reviews.Author: OCLADY
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews and I paid $168.07 (includes tax) for a Friday night and $187.96 for a Sat. night and I didn't get the Deluxe room with a balcony, frig. or microwave. Plus I had to pay $25.00 (non-refundable) for the dog. I had a rather small room with a King Bed, only one sink for the bath area. I had to remove all the junk on the counter top to make room for our personal things. The pool area runs out of towls too. So be sure to take your own beach towel, even though it won't dry out unless you have a balcony to dry it out on. And considering all the complaints about the hair dryers, take your own travel one. I always do. Didn't know about the missing hair conditioner at the front desk or I would've gotten that before hand. I was also disappointed that they didn't have a DVD player with the TV. I'm sure I had one at the Easton PA Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: lneath
Reviews.Content: After much research and time devoted to picking the perfect spot I just went with a tried and true, Hampton. The room was exceptionally clean, large, and felt very peaceful with a balcony and tree just outside. The lobby is well kept and they were doing maintenance while we were there, a good sign of continued upkeep which shows in fresh paint etc. The BIG drawback....PARKING. We came in late and had nowhere to park. The security officer directed me to park in fron of a van, thus blocking his exit. I was hesitant and not liking the situation but did as I was assured this was what I should do or park across the street at Denny's. Well, 7:15 a.m. they called for me to move my car. I was ticked because I knew it would happen. I think they are numb as this is a HUGE problem. No parking. Other that than that glitch is was a great stay, great pool, clean room, fine breakfast and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I Stayed”
Reviews.Author: lippshaw
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about staying here after reading some of the reviews, but I'm glad I took the chance and stayed here. This is a great hotel for those that are self-sufficient. If you need lots of pampering and a resort type atmosphere, this is not your hotel. The rooms were spacious and very clean. I had a microwave and small refrigerator in my room. The balcony overlooking the pool was a nice touch. My room did not face the interstate and train, so it was very quiet. Make sure you request a quiet room away from the train. Breakfast was standard Hampton Inn and there was no shortage of food. Parking is tight, but I was able to find a place each night I stayed. About the location. Yes, there is a strip club two blocks away; however, the only way you know it's there is if you are going there for your own entertainment. Don't let this be your deciding factor. I felt very safe here. If you are traveling through on business or a budget-minded family that would rather spend money on things other than your hotel room, stay here. It is conviently located to local attractions and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: pilot60
Reviews.Content: The good: - Pleasant staff. - Nice lobby. - High speed internet access in rooms. - Pool/jacuzzi. - Convenient from I-8 and I-5 if you have directions. - Central location. The bad: - Lots of traffic in area - not a pleasant place to go for a walk (The noise is not noticeable in the room however). - Room condition is below average for a Hampton Inn since carpets and tile are somewhat worn (not badly). - Not enough parking, and available parking is for sub-compact cars. Many cars end up in street due to lack of parking. If you have a Uhaul or trailer, I recommend you go elsewhere. Expect door dents if you park in the parking lot. If you're on vacation, I would recommend elsewhere as the area around the hotel is not a relaxing atmosphere (lots of traffic and businesses, including strip joint). If you're just passing through, not a bad place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Capitol Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Friday night prior to catching an early flight at the San Diego Airport. I've stayed at Hampton Inns before and am not necessarily a fan, but this was fairly close to the airport and it was reasonably priced (about $100 with tax). It's not in the best neighborhood (some strip clubs and bars adjacent), but I wouldn't label it as a dangerous area. The rooms are typical - nothing fancy. My room was very clean, although the entire place, even the halls, had a funky cleaning-fluid smell. The staff I encountered were reasonably nice and helpful. My only complaint is the loud doors. A peeve of mine is that there is a certain type of hotel visitor who doesn't care when their door slams behind them. The doors in this hotel were very loud and shook the walls. It was very annoying. The hotel shuttle runs once an hour on the half-hour starting at 4:30 a.m. I used this service and was satisfied. While I probably would not stay here again, I don't want to discourage the budget-minded traveler or somebody who wants to stay close to the airport or Sea World. You really do get what you pay for, and this Hampton Inn is not a bad place. Trust me - there are lots worse.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We JUST arrived home from a four night stay at this hotel. While the hotel is located in close proximity to an adult "club", Les Girls, the hotel itself is quite nice. We had a room on the second floor, facing the pool. It was large, had a microwave and refrigerator, very nice bathroom and dressing area and a kingsize bed. There was free (and it WAS free)DSL. The housekeeping was superb...it was always extremely clean...NO complaints there. Parking IS a problem...well, not after you figure out HOW to park!...The spaces are very narrow, so one needs to park early or be ready to take up a space and a half! The staff was great and the morning breakfast was rather good...there were a variety of bagels, English muffins, toast, eggs, sausage, fruits, cereals...much more than one could consume. All in all, we thought it was a good hotel for the price and would be and outstanding one in a nicer location...HOWEVER, one NEVER felt uncomfortable nor uneasy about the location...it is well lit and well maintained.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn San Diego Airport / SeaWorld
HotelInfo.Address: 3888 Greenwood Street, San Diego, CA 92110
